title: Developer Mechanical Engineer
description:
Are you passionate about fine mechanics and eager to make a real difference in people’s lives? Do you want to be part of a fast-growing, innovative company developing life-changing implantable hearing solutions?


At Oticon Medical, we’re on a mission to improve the quality of life for people with severe hearing loss. We’re now looking for a Mechanical Engineer to join our R&D team in Askim, Sweden. Bring your mechanical design expertise – we’ll bring the purpose, the passion, and the people.

 **What You’ll Do**

  

As a Mechanical Engineer, you’ll play a key role in developing our next-generation sound processors and implantable hearing systems. You’ll work in cross-functional teams alongside experts in R&D, Operations, Regulatory, Clinical, and Marketing.


Your responsibilities will include:

  

* Designing micro-mechanical components from concept to production
* CAD modeling (we use PTC Creo)
* Building and testing physical prototypes

Idea creation, design management and verification activities  
* 
* Optimizing designs for cost, performance, and manufacturability
* Managing design changes and updating technical documentation
* Ensuring compliance with medical device regulations and standards
* Document work in accordance with the company's development processes

 **What You Bring**

  

We’re looking for someone who is hands-on, structured, and thrives in a collaborative environment. You likely have:

  

* A BSc or MSc in Mechanical Engineering
* 3–5 years of experience in mechanical design, preferably in medical devices or other regulated industries
* Skills in CAD modeling (preferably Creo)
* Experience with fine mechanics and plastic components
* A proactive, solution-oriented mindset and documentation skills
* Fluency in English (spoken and written)

 **Why Join Us?**

  

* Be part of a purpose-driven company improving lives worldwide
* Work in a dynamic, entrepreneurial environment with a strong team spirit
* Collaborate with passionate colleagues across disciplines and borders
* Enjoy a flexible, supportive, and informal workplace culture

  

We believe the best results come from teamwork. We value knowledge sharing, open communication, and a positive attitude – especially when facing challenges.

 **How to Apply**

  

Submit your CV and application through our online system by 2025-08-15. We do not accept applications via email. Please note as well that the position might close before last application date, so don’t hesitate to apply.


For questions, contact Hanna Peters, Director, Implant Systems, at hass@oticonmedical.com.

title: Senior Developer
description:
Are you ready to make a meaningful impact on the lives of people with hearing impairments? Do you have a passion for mechanical design and a drive to build innovative implantable hearing solutions from the ground up? Join Oticon Medical as a Senior Developer, where your expertise will help shape the future of sound processor technology.  

  

This position is in Gothenburg, Sweden, but with possibility to work from our offices in Kongebakken in Denmark or Nice in France.

 **Your Role:**

  

As a technical lead in our R&D team, you will:

  

* Lead the mechanical development of new sound processors.
* Help build our mechanical development capabilities from scratch, including:
* + Creating working models and prototypes.
	+ Managing supplier interactions and technical communication.
	+ Identifying key development activities and contributing to project planning.
* Apply your experienced knowledge of plastics and manufacturability to ensure robust, scalable designs.
* Drive your own tasks with a proactive and independent mindset.
* Lead concept generation and assess feasibility, desirability, and viability.
* Utilize your experience in:
* + Mechanical design and 3D skeleton modeling.
	+ Material selection and surface treatment.
* Experience of Surface modelling (colloborate with industrial design)
* Work across disciplines in a collaborative environment with R&D, Operations, Regulatory, Clinical, and Marketing.

 **What You Bring:**

  

* A degree in Mechanical Engineering (BSc or MSc), ideally with experience in medical devices or similar high-precision industries.
* Proven ability to lead technical development projects.
* Solid experience in mechanical design, material selection, surface treatment, and 3D skeleton modeling (surface design).
* A strong and deep understanding of fine mechanics, especially in plastics and manufacturing processes.
* Experience with hardware development projects and regulated industries (medical devices is a plus).
* Proficiency in CAD modeling (PTC Creo preferred).
* Excellent communication skills and a collaborative spirit.
* Fluency in English, both written and spoken, is required.

 **Why Oticon Medical?**

  

At Oticon Medical, we’re driven by a mission to improve lives through technology. Join a passionate team where your work will directly impact lives, and where innovation, collaboration, and personal growth are at the heart of everything we do. We offer:

  

* A fast-growing, agile environment where innovation thrives.
* A collaborative culture that values feedback, learning, and shared success.
* The opportunity to work on life-changing products that enhance the quality of life for thousands of people worldwide.
* A dynamic and informal workplace with flexibility, respect, and a strong sense of purpose.

 **How to Apply:**


Submit your CV and application through our online system by 2025-08-15. We do not accept applications via email. Please note as well that the position might close before last application date, so don’t hesitate to apply.


For questions, contact Hanna Peters, Head of Implant Systems, at hass@oticonmedical.com.

title: System Developer / Programmer
description:
About ArinaSoft AB
  
ArinaSoft AB is a forward-thinking technology company at the forefront of automotive innovation. We specialize in delivering high-performance software systems, embedded solutions, and AI-powered safety technologies to leading automotive OEMs and Tier-1 suppliers. Through our commitment to quality, safety, and technological advancement, we are driving the future of mobility toward smarter, safer, and more sustainable roads.
  
At ArinaSoft, we foster a collaborative and knowledge-sharing environment where curiosity is encouraged, expertise is valued, and impact is real.
  
  

About the Role
  
As a System Developer at ArinaSoft AB, you will work on the development of advanced software solutions for the automotive industry. You’ll be involved in the entire development lifecycle—from requirements analysis to implementation, testing, and integration.
  
  

**Key Responsibilities:**  

Design and develop software in C/C++ and/or Python
  
  

Work with embedded systems and real-time applications (RTOS)
  
  

Integrate systems and perform troubleshooting in automotive electronic environments
  
  

Develop applications in Linux-based environments
  
  

Work with vehicle communication protocols such as CAN, LIN, Ethernet
  
  

Use industry-standard tools like Vector CANoe/CANalyzer
  
  

Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams in hardware, software, and testing
  
  

Your Profile
  
  

**We are looking for candidates with:**  

A Master’s or Bachelor’s degree in Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Mechatronics, or a related field
  
  

Minimum 3 years of professional experience in system development within the automotive or industrial domain
  
  

Strong knowledge of C/C++, Git, and scripting (e.g., Bash, Python)
  
  

Experience with Autosar (Classic or Adaptive) is a strong plus
  
  

Familiarity with ISO 26262 (Functional Safety) is highly valued
  
  

Proficiency in English or Swedish, both spoken and written
  
  

A valid Category B driver’s license
  
  

What We Offer
  
Permanent employment with a competitive salary
  
  

Flexible working hours and a hybrid work model
  
  

Wellness allowance and health insurance
  
  

Strong opportunities for professional development and certifications
  
  

A safe, inclusive, and technology-driven work environment
  
  

Öppen för alla
  
Vi fokuserar på din kompetens, inte dina övriga förutsättningar. Vi är öppna för att anpassa rollen eller arbetsplatsen efter dina behov.

title: TEAM LEAD & BACKEND SOFTWARE DEVELOPER
description:
THE WOW
   


 As a Team Lead at Betsson Group, you will lead a team of talented people and take overall responsibility for team performance. As the Team Lead, you will take an active role in driving the delivery of your team and promoting a healthy team spirit and culture. You will also participate as a developer in designing and developing next generation Engagement products for the iGaming industry.  
 


  

 ABOUT THE JOB
   



 As part of this team, you will use cutting edge technology to develop highly scalable and resilient application. As a team lead you will also enable us to get these applications into the hands of our users safely, quickly, and sustainably. In Engagement Area, We develop products to boost customer engagement. Our goal is to provide the best customer experience on the market, and we do that through personalized communication, interesting and fun promotions, and gamification. We work closely with our commercial users to ensure we deliver the best CRM tools and products. All designed and developed by us and delivered safely, quickly and sustainably using best-if-bread technologies and processes. 
 



  

 As a Team Lead and Backend Developer, your day to day will look like
   

  
* People management, mentoring and coaching developers, taking part in recruiting and onboarding, performance reviews, personal development planning and 1-to-1’s.
  
* Close collaboration with Product Managers, Architects, and Stakeholders to understand and implement business requirements.
  
* Software development according to modern best practices and principles.
  
* Taking part in the decision-making process for design or improvement of application architecture, solution development, architecture, and code review
  


  

 WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR
   

  
* Experience in software development for more than 5 years
  
* Experience of managing teams of software engineers
  
* Strong leadership and communication skills
  
* Agile mindset, business goals orientation
  
* Excellent knowledge and experience in C#, .NET Framework, and .NET Core
  


  

 WHAT DOES OUR TECH STACK LOOK LIKE?
   


 At Betsson, we pride ourselves on adaptability and keeping up with the latest technologies. Our current tech stack looks like this
 


  

  
* C#, .NET Framework, .NET Core,
  
* AWS, Kubernetes, Docker
  
* PostgreSQL, MSSQL, Redis, Couchbase
  
* Apache Kafka, RabbitMQ
  
* Prometheus, Loki, Grafana
  
* GitHub
  


  

 WHAT WE OFFER
   


 Life at Betsson can be lightning fast with twists and turns but always FUN! Then again, what else would you expect from a business 75% millennial and 1700 strong, spread across 7 offices with 900 based out of our Malta HQ alone! We recognize it may not be for the faint-hearted, but if you’re a go-getter, initiator and adrenaline junkie, always striving to push the boundaries and challenge yourself, then you’ll fit right in.
 


  


 We offer numerous challenges where your skills will be put to good use! We encourage innovation, independence and celebrate success where you will be part of multi-cultural and diverse company, with people from all over the world.
 


  

 CHALLENGE ACCEPTED?
   


 If you are interested to learn more, please apply with your CV.
 


  


 Check out the Betsson Group Blog to find out what our employees are talking about
 


  


 By submitting your application, you understand that your personal data will be processed as set out in our Privacy Policy

title: Software Engineer (Scala), Remote
description:
Everything we do is for our customers!
   

  

 Featured on Deloitte's Technology Fast 500 list and G2's leaderboard, Maropost offers a unified commerce experience that our customers need, transforming ecommerce, retail, marketing automation, merchandising, helpdesk and AI operations with one platform designed to scale for fast-growing businesses. With a relentless focus on our customers’ success, we are motivated by customer obsession, extreme urgency, excellence and resourcefulness to to power 5,000+ global brands while we head to 100,000+.
   

  

 Driven by the same customer-centric mentality as above, we empower businesses to achieve their goals and grow alongside us. If you're a driver and not passenger and are ready to make a significant impact and be part of our transformative journey, Maropost is the place for you.
   

  

**The Opportunity**
 Thrive on change and grow beyond limits! We are looking for a bold thinker who sees a chance to learn and define what's possible with every challenge! Ready to make an impact? Welcome to Maropost and you can turn ideas into action!
   

  

 We are looking for an open-minded and enthusiastic intermediate-level Scala Engineer to join our backend team. We are a passionate and highly collaborative team with a bias for quality and continuous improvement. If you are looking for an environment where you can learn and see your ideas come to life, let's talk!
   

  

 The role will be based in Europe. Core working hours for this role are 9:00am-5:00pm CET (+/- 2 hours).
   

  

**What You'll Be Responsible For**
* Design and write sustainable, easy-to-read, and elegant code, rearchitecting and refactoring existing software where needed.
* Contributing to technical and product specs, and collaborating on architecture and design decisions together with the other stakeholders
* Testing the software you build for reliability and robustness using different testing paradigms and libraries
* Review feedback on the specs and the code as an opportunity for continuous improvement and collaborative design, and carrying out spec and code review for your coworkers
* Make recommendations regarding introducing new tools and improving processes.
* Continuous learning of different programming paradigms and new technologies
* Work with a highly collaborative group of engineers.


**What You'll Bring To Maropost** 
  

  

* 3+ years of experience in Scala.
* 2+ years' experience with mapping business domains into SQL schemas.
* Experience with message-based architectures (we use Pulsar).
* Knowledge in API design (REST or GraphQL).
* Understand and work with modern cloud-native infrastructure (we deploy to Kubernetes).
* Responsible for builds and CI/CD processes (we use CircleCI for builds and GitOps with ArgoCD for back-end deployments).
* Excellent communication skills, a bias for feedback and continuous improvement, combined with the ability to work collaboratively in cross-functional teams.
* The ability to take ownership and initiatives over tasks/projects and share any new ideas with the team.
* You exemplify Maropost’s Values:
+ Customer Obsessed
+ Extreme Urgency
+ Excellence
+ Resourceful


 Message from the Founders: Maropost is looking for builders - people who want to drive our business forward at all costs in order to achieve the goals we have both short and long term for the results and outcomes that that will bring to us all.
   

  

 If that isn't for you that’s ok, for those of you that it is please get in touch with us!

title: Java Developer
description:
Vill du vara en del av en unik gemenskap och jobba med utmanande tekniska projekt? Nu söker vi efter en erfaren Java-utvecklare till HiQ Stockholm!
   

  

 I rollen som Java utvecklare hos oss kommer du arbeta i varierande uppdrag och utveckla samhällskritiska system i en rad olika branscher som exempelvis finans, försvar eller offentlig sektor. Uppdragen kan vara på plats hos kund, in-house eller helt remote – beroende på vad som passar dig och kunden bäst. Du blir en viktig del i team där du bidrar med din tekniska kompetens, ditt engagemang och din vilja att utvecklas.
   

  

 Som en av oss på HiQ får du inte bara möjlighet att jobba med kompetenta kollegor och utvecklande uppdrag, du får även ett kontor med stark teamanda, fantastisk utsikt över Slussen och en roll där du får diskutera och lösa komplexa situationer tillsammans med dina kollegor.
   

  

**Vi söker dig som har:**
* Ingenjörsexamen inom datateknik, teknisk fysik, elektroteknik eller motsvarande
* Minst 4 års arbetslivserfarenhet av Javautveckling
* Erfarenhet av CI/CD, testautomation och agila metoder
* En positiv inställning och en stark drivkraft att hjälpa till och lösa kundens problem
* Svenskt medborgarskap samt är flytande i svenska och engelska


**Det här erbjuder vi:**
* Brett utbett av uppdrag hos välkända företag i flera branscher
* Kompetensutveckling, techforum och kunskapsdelning internt
* En prestigelös, varm och familjär arbetsplats med högt i tak och hjälpsamma kollegor
* En trygg anställning med bra förmåner


**Vad händer nu?**
 Vi jobbar med löpande urval så tveka inte att skicka in din ansökan redan idag. För att göra rekryteringsprocessen så rättvis och objektiv som möjligt kommer det att ingå urvalsfrågor, intervjuer, tekniska tester, referenstagning och bakgrundskontroll.

title: Software Engineer - ML platform
description:
At Lendo, Scandinavia’s largest marketplace for loans, we are on a mission to empower people to make smarter financial decisions. Our digital customer experience is powered by data & AI, helping users navigate complex financial choices with confidence.
   

  

 We are now looking for an experienced software engineer to join our Data & ML team. Not to build models, but to design, build, and maintain the platform that enables machine learning to run reliably in production. This is a role for engineers who have experience building robust systems, infrastructure, and integrations, and who want to get involved in AI and ML development.
   

  

**Why join us?**
* Make a difference. You will be a part of a highly competent and result-driven team in a fast-paced fintech company where data is at the heart of everything we do. Your work will translate directly into measurable business value – for example, when an ML-driven feature boosts conversion rates or powers better user experiences. At Lendo, you will be able to say, “I made that happen” when our ML solutions drive better decisions for users and create growth for the company.
* Freedom with responsibility. We believe in trusting great engineers. You will have high ownership, real autonomy, and the space to shape your own approach, backed by a team that values accountability and collaboration. You will help make key technical decisions, introduce best practices, and drive platform evolution.
* Work across the data spectrum. You will collaborate daily with other software engineers, data scientists, and data engineers, giving you exposure to multiple facets of the ML lifecycle. This is a great opportunity to deepen your expertise or broaden your skills across disciplines.
* Hybrid setup, global culture. Join a welcoming, international company with colleagues from 20+ nationalities. Our flexible setup combines the best of in-person collaboration with the freedom of remote work. On top of that, we offer competitive salaries.


**What You Will Do**
* Take end-to-end ownership of our ML platform and inference systems, making sure they are robust and scalable.
* Design, maintain, and optimize production-ready machine learning applications, including integrating ML applications into our microservices architecture.
* Use modern tech such as Python (FastAPI), Kubernetes, Docker, PostgreSQL, GCP, Pub/Sub, BigQuery, Terraform, ArgoCD, and CI/CD pipelines.
* Ensure strong observability, logging, and monitoring of ML systems with tools like Prometheus and Grafana.
* Collaborate with data scientists and other engineers deliver ML-driven features.
* Implement best practices in monitoring, testing, and versioning for ML systems.
* Support the team in handling complex technical environments across different markets.

title: Senior Fullstack and Design Engineer -  Schibsted User Identity
description:
We are looking to grow our team with a full stack engineer with interest in Design Systems.
   

  

**Who we are:**
 Our democracies depend on independent journalism. At Schibsted, we provide the technology behind some of the leading media brands in the Nordics - products that reach millions of people every day.
   

  

 The User Identity team builds essential services like login, account management, and consent handling, enabling our users to engage safely and meaningfully across all Schibsted platforms.
   

  

 We're growing, and we’re especially eager to bring in new perspectives that reflect our broad audience.
   

  

**What we do:**
 We’re a cross-functional, product-focused team with end-to-end ownership of key user identity services. You’ll work with engineers, designers, and product managers to solve meaningful problems, ranging from compliance and privacy to UX and performance. We work collaboratively with pairing, code reviews, and async-friendly rituals
   

  

* We dedicate 10% of our time (every second Friday) to learning, experimenting, or sharing knowledge
* We take part in company-wide hackathons and contribute to internal learning communities
* We aim to follow Agile principles in a way that supports our team autonomy


**Our Tech stack:**
 We mostly use JavaScript / TypeScript in our products, with Node, React and Github Actions, we leverage AWS services (MKS, Lambda, SNS / SQS). We use tools like Figma and Storybook to manage our designs.
   

  

**About you:**
 We are now looking for a full stack developer who has solid experience in frontend development and has a passion for Design Systems.
   

  

* You have a deep knowledge of JavaScript (React, Node.js, TypeScript)
* You have experience in Design tools (Figma, Storybook)
* You have a solid knowledge of optimization of user interface performance and responsiveness
* You have experience or interest in establishing and maintaining Design Systems
* You have a good understanding of the concepts of and/or experience with continuous deployment, integration and unit tests, documentation and GitHub.


**What we offer:**
* A team culture that puts learning and growth at the center - we dedicate 10% of our time (every second Friday) to skill-building, collaboration, and experimentation
* Opportunities to shape how design systems and identity services evolve across the company
* A flexible work setup that supports both focus time and collaboration, with hybrid working as the norm.
* The chance to work on high-impact products used across leading media brands in the Nordics

title: Android Developer, Retail App, Solna/Hybrid
company_industry: Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage
description:
We are building the essential Retail solutions used at thousands of servicepoints across the Nordics. By providing our network partners with the most intuitive and reliable tools on the market, we play an integral role in PostNord’s growth.
   

  

 Through user-centric mobile applications and serverless architecture, we enable millions of customer interactions every year. Our team proudly takes the lead on developing creative and scalable solutions to re-shape the user experience at our physical locations. We are now looking for an Android developer to join us on this journey!
   

  

 You are an Android developer with a passion for teamwork. While striving for optimisation and simplification, you tackle complex business requirements with technical practises and problem-solving skills.
   

  

 By leading with humility and curiosity, you also empower your fellow team members in their own technical development. You are used to the challenges that modern computing platforms bring such as asynchronous programming and are comfortable with the reactive programming paradigm.
   

  

 ,
   

  

* BSc degree in Engineering and minimum 3 years of work experience in Mobile development
* Significant experience programming for the Android platform, using Java and/or Kotlin
* Some experience in Jetpack Compose


**We offer you**
**Responsibilities**
 We offer a variety of work and a lot of freedom and empowerment in an international environment with constantly new challenges and quick decisions. Here you have opportunities and freedom to develop creative solutions and you will be able to switch responsibilities within the team as you see fit for your and the teams’ qualities and experiences. You will be hired by PostNord Sweden which is one of Sweden's largest workplaces and we offer safe employment conditions and benefits. In addition to the benefits mentioned above, we offer:
   

  

* Hybrid workplace with a Nordic and dynamic environment. Watch the video about our office.
* Great development opportunities
* Great insurance and occupational pension terms
* Wellness allowance & opportunity to train at Arken's gym and indoor swimming pool
* Employee benefits through PostNord Plus - PostNord´s own personnel foundation


**We make everyday life easier**
 PostNord is the leading supplier of communication and logistics solutions to, from, and within the Nordic region. We ensure the provision of a postal service to households and businesses in Sweden and Denmark. We aim to make everyday life easier and more sustainable for everyone who lives and works in the Nordic region.
   

  

 We are accountable, brave and committed, effectively leading change regardless of whether we lead ourselves or others. We emphasize teamwork, sincerity and positive relationships in the workplace. We build on our success and learn from both colleagues and mistakes. People with different backgrounds work with us. You will therefore be part of a workplace with great diversity, which contributes to better results for the business. Visit us at postnord.com
   

  

**Apply**
 What are you waiting for? Send in your application! Due to the summer holiday period, responses and follow-ups may take a bit longer than usual. We will be back after the vacation in August and look forward to reconnecting with you then. If you have any questions, feel free to contact manager malin.rydman@postnord.com.
   

  

 We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Community Engineer (multiple roles and seniority levels)
description:
Our ambition is to set a standard of excellence when it comes to serving the open source ecosystem. This is your chance to be a part of that as a
 **Community Engineer at Canonical** 
 .
   

  

 We are building community management at scale. We have multiple positions available, at different seniority levels.
   

  

**All applications and candidates are handled through this single entry point.**
 The role of a Community Engineer
   

  

 The Community team at Canonical enables community leaders and participants to get things done, co-ordinating with Canonical teams and ensuring that community processes are efficient and well run. We don't do the work of the community, but we facilitate that work to ensure that energetic and ambitious community members with their own vision of open source can benefit from the work Canonical does and bring their own flavor of Ubuntu into being, to meet the needs and express the interests of their community. You will play a key role in designing, executing, and scaling initiatives that foster a thriving community.
   

  

 This is an exciting opportunity for a technically proficient person who is passionate about open source software, Linux, and sustainable community building.
   

  

 In this role, you will support community initiatives with your technical skills and strong organizational skills. You work hand in hand with developers to smooth processes and integrate community plans with Canonical plans for maximum impact. You can encourage and facilitate the creation of new technical projects that enhance the community contribution experience, and you represent community interests to Canonical teams. You will lead complex, multi-disciplinary programs from conception through launch, working closely with Developer Relations engineers, technical authors, product managers, marketing teams, engineering teams, and external partners.
   

  

 You will support and engage with volunteer developers in the Ubuntu community, addressing their concerns and helping them to create successful tools. You will help to ensure their success and the overall autonomy and sustainability of projects.
   

  

 You will provide the content and technical support to ensure the community stays engaged and informed. This will include regular blog and social media posts about community initiatives, events, accomplishments, and collaborative efforts between Canonical and the Ubuntu community.
   

  

 You will communicate effectively with developers and software engineers and represent not only the Ubuntu community but Canonical as a contributor to the wider Linux ecosystem. Our team attends conferences and expos, and talks about technical community projects and their development processes.
   

  

**Location** 
 : These are fully remote roles, open to candidates across the globe.
   

  

 What your day will look like
   

  

* Write high quality content to promote and support community initiatives
* Discuss ideas and collaborate on finding good solutions to community problems
* Work from home with global travel 2 to 4 weeks for internal and external events
* Potential opportunity to travel more if you wish
* Nurture community contributions to Ubuntu
* Engage with the Ubuntu community through Discourse, Matrix, social media, conferences, etc.
* Represent Ubuntu via speaking engagements at events and conferences
* Support the engagement by Canonical teams into the open source ecosystem


 What we are looking for in you
   

  

* You love technology and working with brilliant people
* You are curious, flexible, articulate, and accountable
* You value soft skills and are passionate, enterprising, thoughtful, and self-motivated
* You have experience with developer tools and open source projects
* You have a clear public record of accomplishments (talks, blog posts, GitHub, X, etc.)
* You have interest and experience with some of the following: Ubuntu Linux - kernel or userspace, DevOps, software development, testing and QA, package management, container technology
* You can work autonomously and assume full ownership of objectives as needed
* You can be flexible with your time and enjoy working with new technology in a fast-paced environment
* You are experienced working with open source communities and understand the workflow of volunteer contributors
* You have experience in (technical) program management and have excellent organizational, communication and interpersonal skills


**Additional Skills That You Might Also Bring**
* Experience with community management
* Experience with Developer advocacy
* Experience as a software developer
* Examples of contributions to the Ubuntu Community
* Experience with contributing to open source projects


**What we offer** 
 colleagues
   

  

 We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognize outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus or commission. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
   

  

* Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
* Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Maternity and paternity leave
* Employee Assistance Program
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
* Priority Pass, and travel upgrades for long haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world of software. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Most colleagues at Canonical have worked from home since its inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.
   

  

**Canonical is an equal opportunity employer**
 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

 PostNord is the leading supplier of communication and logistics solutions to, from, and within the Nordic region. We aim to make everyday life easier and more sustainable for everyone who lives and works in the Nordic region.
   

  

 We are accountable, brave and committed, effectively leading change regardless of whether we lead ourselves or others. We emphasize teamwork, sincerity and positive relationships in the workplace. We build on our success and learn from both colleagues and mistakes. People with different backgrounds work with us. You will therefore be part of a workplace with great diversity, which contributes to better results for the business. Visit us at postnord.com
   

  

**Apply**
 What are you waiting for? Send in your application! Due to the summer holiday period, responses and follow-ups may take a bit longer than usual. We will be back after the vacation in August and look forward to reconnecting with you then. If you have any questions, feel free to contact manager malin.rydman@postnord.com.
   

  

 We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Developer & Module Specialist - SuccessFactors
description:
*Vill du vara en nyckelspelare i att vidareutveckla och driva HR-system i en organisation med starkt fokus på tillväxt och innovation? Vi söker nu en certifierad SuccessFactors Developer and Module Specialist till vårt framåtriktade interna IT-team!*
**Om jobbet**
 Som SuccessFactors Developer and Module Specialist kommer du att inneha en expertroll i vår interna IT-organisation och arbeta nära HR-funktionen. Du kommer att förvalta, integrera och implementera funktionalitet i SuccessFactors olika moduler. Genom ditt arbete kommer du att säkerställa en smidig, stabil och snabb implementering av ny programvara och uppdateringar i installerade applikationer. Du kommer att tillsammans med övriga teamet medverka i frågor rörande aktuella och framtida vägval för plattformens tekniska utveckling.
   

  

 Dina arbetsuppgifter kommer vara bland annat:
   

  

* Ansvara för ny systemkonfiguration samt sätta sig in i befintlig konfiguration
* Utföra felsökning och problemlösning när systemet inte fungerar som förväntat
* Hitta lösningar på komplexa problem och stödja organisationen i implementeringen av nya funktioner
* Assistera vid uppgraderingar genom att förstå SAP:s processer och sätta sig in i dokumentation kring uppgraderingens nyheter
* Hålla koll på SuccessFactors roadmap och föreslå hur ny funktionalitet kan integreras i systemet
* Assistera med testning av ny funktionalitet
* Bistå med bakgrundsmaterial och delta i diskussioner med SAP Support vid komplexa supportärenden
* Kontinuerligt vidareutbilda systemadministratörerna för att stärka deras kompetens


**Vem är du?**
 Följande kommer göra dig framgångsrik i denna tjänst:
   

  

* Du jobbar redan idag som applikationskonsult/specialist inom SuccessFactors-området och är expert på SuccessFactors EC (Employee Central). Denna roll kräver en konfigureringsexpert med medellång (3–5 års) erfarenhet som är eller har varit certifierad i SuccessFactors EC-modul och/eller någon av följande moduler: LMS, PMGM eller Compensation¨
* Du har en akademisk examen inom IT eller motsvarande
* Har erfarenhet av att samarbeta med olika intressenter och förmåga att kommunicera tekniska lösningar på ett enkelt och pedagogiskt sätt.
* Du har goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift


 Som person brinner du för att uppnå verksamhetsnytta med hjälp av IT och verkar för att säkerställa leveranser med hög kvalitet. Du har en stark analytisk förmåga och kan se helheten i komplexa IT-system och HR-processer. Du är självständig och leveranssäker i ditt arbete med lätt för såväl reaktiv som proaktiv problemlösning. Ditt team lägger stort fokus på innovation och utveckling och vi ser därför gärna att du delar vårt intresse för att se möjligheter i varje process.
   

  

**Om oss**
 Vi erbjuder en spännande roll i en organisation som värdesätter innovation och förbättring. Du får möjligheten att arbeta med de senaste HR-teknologierna i en miljö med starkt fokus på digitalisering. Vi erbjuder en inkluderande och tillitsbaserad arbetsmiljö där din kompetens och erfarenhet gör skillnad, samt goda möjligheter till kompetensutveckling och påverkan inom din roll.
   

  

**Mer information**
*Låter det spännande? Då vill vi veta mer om dig! Välkommen med din ansökan redan idag. Vi arbetar löpande med denna rekrytering och kan komma att tillsätta tjänsten innan sista ansökningsdag.*
***Observera att svarstiden för denna rekryteringsprocess kan vara längre än vanligt, detta på grund av semestertider. Vi uppskattar ditt tålamod och kommer att återkomma så snart som möjligt.***
**Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-08-15**

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
Vill du vara med och bygga en modern DevOps-miljö för framtidens bank- och försäkringslösningar? Vi söker en senior DevOps Engineer som vill vara drivande i att utveckla vår leveransplattform och våra molnlösningar – i en organisation där teknik, kultur och kundvärde går hand i hand.
   

  

**Om jobbet**
 Rollen som DevOps Engineer är central i vår produktutveckling där fokus ligger på att effektivisera, automatisera och skala upp vår tekniska leveransförmåga. Du kommer att arbeta på en plattform där utvecklingsteam snabbt och säkert kan bygga, testa, deploya och övervaka applikationer genom välstrukturerade pipelines och self-service-lösningar.
   

  

 Du kommer att:
   

  

* Etablera och vidareutveckla vår Internal Developer Platform (IDP)
* Automatisera hela utvecklingsflödet genom CI/CD-pipelines, releasehantering och deployment-strategier
* Samarbeta med produktteam, säkerhet, drift och arkitekter för att driva DevOps-praxis i hela utvecklingskedjan
* Designa och implementera robusta DevOps-lösningar i Azure Cloud (primär plattform) – AWS är meriterande
* Integrera säkerhet och regelefterlevnad-förmågor i leveranskedjan (Shift Left & DevSecOps)
* Bidra till vision, strategi och roadmap för vår gemensamma utvecklingsplattform
* Delta i tekniska communitys och kunskapsdelning över team och ARTs


 Du arbetar agilt i en organisation som tillämpar SAFe i stor skala, och du blir en viktig del i att bygga en skalbar, resilient och produktiv DevOps-miljö.
   

  

**Vem är du?**
 Du är en tekniskt stark och nyfiken och brinner för automation, struktur och utvecklarupplevelse. Du har ett holistiskt tänk kring plattform och värdeskapande utveckling, och du trivs i en roll där du får kombinera teknik med samarbete, strategi och förbättringsarbete. Du är en doer med struktur och integritet – och en naturlig lagspelare i agila team.
   

  

 Vi tror att du har:
   

  

* Minst 10 års erfarenhet inom DevOps, systemutveckling eller plattformsutveckling
* Gedigen erfarenhet av Azure Cloud, containerplattformar som OpenShift/Kubernetes/Docker
* Djup förståelse för CI/CD-principer, infrastrukturautomatisering och pipelineförmågor
* Erfarenhet av att bygga eller arbeta med Internal Developer Platforms (IDP)
* Förmåga att skapa self-service-funktionalitet och stödja developer experience
* Kunskap inom Infrastructure as Code (IaC) med t.ex. Terraform, ARM/Bicep eller liknande
* Förståelse för säkerhetsaspekter i DevOps (t.ex. hemlighetshantering, SAST/DAST, policy enforcement)
* Erfarenhet av arbete i agila ramverk, gärna SAFe
* Hög teknisk kommunikationsförmåga – du kan både förenkla och fördjupa beroende på målgrupp
* Grundläggande förståelse för svenska och engelska i tal och skrift och en ambition att ständigt utvecklas


 Meriterande:
   

  

* Erfarenhet av AWS och hybrid cloud-miljöer
* Erfarenhet av observability-verktyg och metricsbaserad utveckling
* Kunskap inom GitOps, eventdriven arkitektur och serverless
* Erfarenhet från plattformsdriven utveckling i större organisationer


**Om oss**
 Process and Dev Tools är en del av Digital Solution & Operation Platform, DSOP inom vår IT-organisation Digital & IT. Vi erbjuder stöd, förmågor, verktyg, tekniska plattformar samt processer för samtliga utvecklingsteam inom Länsförsäkringar. Vi arbetar enligt SAFe, med en tydlig vision att skapa en hållbar och effektiv produktutveckling – där DevOps är en självklar grundförutsättning.
   

  

 Teamet består idag av Produkt Owners, DevOps Engineers, Scrum Masters och Process Owner som tillsammans ansvarar för våra förmågor och processer för IT-utveckling. Vi erbjuder en inkluderande laganda med högt i tak kultur och stora möjligheter till utveckling.
   

  

**Mer information**
*Låter det spännande? Då vill vi veta mer om dig! Välkommen med din ansökan redan idag. Vi arbetar löpande med denna rekrytering och kan komma att tillsätta tjänsten innan sista ansökningsdag.*
**Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-08-01**

title: Systemingenjör inom 5G utveckling
description:
**Syntronic bygger djup kompetens inom elektronik, inbyggda system och mekatronik för att möta våra kunders krav och utveckla framtidens mest avancerade teknik.**
 Vi söker just nu efter kunniga systemingenjörer som vill ingå i ett unikt och avancerat team, som tillsammans ansvarar för kravhanteringen för de senaste produkterna och funktionaliteterna inom radioutveckling. Arbetet innebär att fastställa krav från kund och marknaden för att kunna designa, integrera samt verifiera de senaste 5G radioprodukterna. Så vänta inte, om du vill vara i framkant inom telekomutveckling, sök nu!
   

  

**Som Systemingenjör hos oss kommer du bland annat att:**
* Definiera arkitekturer, gränssnitt samt specificera funktionella- och prestanda- och regulatoriska krav
* Vara inriktad mot någon typ av kravhantering, tex prestandakrav och/eller regulatoriska krav
* Vara ”spindeln i nätet” där du i samråd med utvecklare formar och specificerar kravmängden
* Analysera eventuella avsteg från krav.


**Vi söker en Systemingenjör som:**
* Har en Högskole- eller civilingenjörsutbildning inom Elektro, Data, Teknisk fysik eller motsvarande
* Genomfört ett antal kommersiella kundprojekt inom inbyggda system i en systemledande roll eller som mjukvaru- och/eller hårdvaruutvecklare
* Behärskar svenska och engelska flytande i tal och skrift.


 Syntronic erbjuder en trygg anställning i en dynamisk och framåtriktad miljö. Att vi är ett team är vår styrka, därför ser vi att du arbetar tillsammans på plats med oss på kontoret – när du inte behövs hos någon av våra kunder förstås!
   

  

**Personliga egenskaper**
 Som systemingenjör hos oss värderar du struktur, planering samt ordning och reda utan att förlora din kreativa sida. Du är samarbetsvillig, social och kommunikativ då arbetet förutsätter mycket samarbete internt såväl med kunder.
   

  

**Vi erbjuder**
 På Syntronic blir du en del av en härlig gemenskap där din röst hörs och dina idéer välkomnas. Vi erbjuder flexibla arbetstider, balans mellan arbete och fritid samt regelbundna karriärutvecklingssamtal och interna workshops för din utveckling. Utöver detta får du förmånliga förmåner och försäkringar. Hos oss får du inte bara ett jobb – du får en plats att växa och trivas både personligt och professionellt. Välkommen till Syntronic!
   

  

**Ansökan**
 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan, som ska vara oss tillhanda senast 29 augusti. Vi arbetar med löpande urval.
   

  

 Sommaren närmar sig och med den följer semestertider. Det kan därför förekomma viss fördröjning i vår rekryteringsprocess under denna period. Vi tackar för ert tålamod och ser fram emot att höra från er!
   

  

 Bakgrundskontroller kan förekomma.
   

  

 Av kommunikation- och kvalitetssäkringsskäl ber vi dig att skicka in din ansökan digitalt via vårt system och inte via e-post.

title: Dynamics 365 Specialister - CE / F&SCM, Nexer Enterprise Applications
description:
**Nexer Enterprise Applications befinner sig på en tillväxtresa och vi söker nu fler Dynamics 365-specialister som vill utvecklas i sin karriär och arbeta med spännande uppdrag. Vill du göra skillnad för våra kunder tillsammans med ett härligt team av specialister? Då vill vi att du ska bli en del av vårt gäng på Nexer!**
**Att arbeta på Nexer Enterprise Applications**
 Hos oss hittar du en familjär kultur med bra sammanhållning och nära ledarskap. Vi är ett välkänt namn inom Microsoft Dynamics och Microsoft 365, både i Sverige och internationellt. Här får du möjligheten att påverka din karriär och utvecklas inom områden som lösningsarkitektur, pre-sales eller som mentor/handledare åt yngre kollegor. Nexer erbjuder en unik kombination av storföretagets stabilitet och den lilla verksamhetens möjlighet att påverka och få saker att hända. Vi har en stark vilja att driva affärer och firar våra framgångar med regelbundna events, resor och konferenser.
   

  

 Alla våra roller är hybrida med möjlighet att tillhöra något av våra kontor i Stockholm, Göteborg, Lund, Västerås eller Eskilstuna – valet är ditt!
   

  

**Vad vi erbjuder dig**
* En flexibel arbetspolicy, med möjlighet att arbeta hemifrån när det passar dig och ditt team.
* Kompetensutveckling genom interna forum och Nexer Academy.
* Ett stöttande team och en organisation med mångfald och entreprenörsanda.
* Möjlighet att delta i CSR-arbete genom initiativ som Star for Life, Pink Programming och Nexer Network Women.
* En arbetsplats med regelbundna spelkvällar, träningsutmaningar och årliga konferenser.


**Vem är du?**
 Vi söker dig med driv och engagemang som vill hjälpa våra kunder att lyckas med Dynamics 365 och utveckla vår position som ledande Dynamics-företag. Du kan vara funktionell konsult, lösningsarkitekt, teknisk lösningsarkitekt, utvecklare, projektledare eller inom arbeta finans. Vi kan erbjuda roller både inom projekt, förvaltning och/eller sälj.
   

  

**Vill du bli en del av vårt team? Vi söker dig som:**
* Har flerårig erfarenhet av end-to-end Microsoft Dynamics 365 F&SCM och/eller CE-implementationer.
* Är van vid att facilitera workshops och kravinsamling.
* Talar och skriver flytande på svenska och engelska.


 Meriterande kvalifikationer:
   

  

* Erfarenhet inom flera moduler i Dynamics 365, gärna produktion.
* Erfarenhet inom Dynamics CE-apparna Field Service eller Customer Insight.
* Kunskap om agila principer och Azure DevOps.
* Kompetens inom Power Platform och/eller Azure.


 Du trivs i ett team där mångfald och jämställdhet värderas och bidrar till din egen, teamets, våra kunders och företagets framgång.
   

  

 Läs mer om oss: Nexer Enterprise Applications
   

  

**Ansökan**
 Du är varmt välkommen att skicka in din ansökan nedan. Vi har tyvärr ingen möjlighet att ta emot ansökningar via e-post, men har du frågor om tjänsten eller Nexer får du gärna höra av dig Maja Åström på maja.astrom@nexergroup.com. Vi hanterar ansökningarna löpande, så vänta inte med att söka!

title: Teknisk Testare inom Financial Crime Prevention till Handelsbanken
description:
*Vi söker en teknisk testare med stort intresse för tester och automatisering som vill påverka och utveckla arbetet med att förebygga finansiell brottslighet.*
**Ditt team**
 Financial Crime Prevention är ett högt prioriterat område med många både pågående och kommande utvecklingsinitiativ. Vi är just nu inne i en intensiv och spännande period med flera systembyten och ett stort strategiskt FCP-program som precis har startat. I nära samarbete med verksamheten så utvecklar och levererar vi det systemstöd de behöver för det viktiga arbetet med att motverka penningtvätt och finansiering av terrorism samt att efterleva internationella sanktioner. Vi har kul på arbetet och tror på att lösa problem tillsammans samtidigt som vi uppmuntrar nya idéer. Du kommer bli en del av ett av våra utvecklingsteam som består av Utvecklare, en Team Coach, och en Product Owner.
   

  

**Din roll**
 Som Teknisk Testare kommer du ansvara över verifiering och kvalitetssäkring av leveransen till användarna. Det innebär att du tillsammans med teamet både planerar, genomför och dokumenterar tester samtidigt som du även utvecklar teamets teststrategier. Du kommer vara en del av ett nära samarbete med andra team inom- och utanför vårt område vilket innebär att du är med i alla faser av systemutvecklingen, från idé till implementering. I den tidiga fasen av systemutvecklingen kommer din förmåga att kritiskt granska krav och systemlösning vara betydelsefull för kvalitetssäkringen.
   

  

 I rollen ingår även arbetsuppgifter som att:
   

  

* Analysera testresultat och kommunicera feedback till utvecklingsteamet
* Sprida kunskap och hålla dig uppdaterad om trender inom testområdet
* Ta fram och vidareutveckla teststrategier och testautomatisering
* Ta fram förbättringsförslag för testprocessen och bidra till att skapa effektiva arbetssätt


 ,
   

  

**Din profil**
 Vi söker dig som har gedigen erfarenhet av rollen som testare, testledare eller liknande roll och arbetat med tekniska tester. Du är van vid att arbeta med att skapa testplaner, testfall och genomföra både manuella och automatiska tester i samarbete med utvecklare och verksamhet. Din tekniska förståelse är god och du har erfarenhet av att planera och arbeta i olika systemmiljöer, tekniker och plattformar. Vi ser även att du har kunskap om testverktyg och en vana att ta fram egna testfall med hjälp av dessa. Då vi samarbetar med hela koncernen behöver du goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift.
   

  

 Det är meriterande om du har erfarenhet av:
   

  

* API testning med verktyg som tex Postman, ReadyAPI
* programmering i Java eller JavaScript
* testautomatisering
* testdriven utveckling (TDD)
* Agilt arbetssätt


 Som person ser vi att du trivs med att lösa komplexa uppgifter genom att samla in relevant information, analysera den noggrant och fatta välgrundade beslut utifrån ett helhetsperspektiv. Du arbetar för att förbättra och automatisera testprocesser för att öka kvalitet och effektivitet. Det kommer naturligt för dig att tänka i nya banor för att komma fram till skalbara lösningar samtidigt som du håller dig uppdaterad inom testområdet. Du kan beskriva problem för andra samt varför de behöver åtgärdas. Det är viktigt att du även organiserar och dokumenterar ditt arbete så att du och andra kan följa det.
   

  

**Välkommen med din ansökan!**
*Vi går igenom ansökningarna löpande och återkommer så snart vi har möjlighet. Med anledning av semestertider kan urvalsprocessen komma att fördröjas och återkoppling ske först efter vecka 33, vi hoppas du har överseende med detta.*
**Vi erbjuder**
* en trygg och stabil arbetsgivare
* dynamiskt och stimulerande arbete
* work-life balance
* kompetens- och karriärutveckling
* inkluderande- och jämställd arbetsmiljö
* konkurrenskraftigt förmånspaket


**Kontaktuppgifter**
**Rekryterande chef:** 
 Maria Netterberg, maria.netterberg@handelsbanken.se
   

  

**TA Partner:** 
 Alva Jonerot, alva.jonerot@handelsbanken.se
   

  

**Facklig representant Finansförbundet:**
 Michael Löfström, michael.lofstrom@handelsbanken.se
   

  

**Facklig representant Akademikerföreningen:** 
 Bjarne Nilsson , bjarne.nilsson@handelsbanken.se

title: Product Designer
description:
*Global migration is a 21st-century reality. Whether people are fleeing from something or racing towards better opportunity, following love or seeking new experiences, more and more are living in different environments and in new ways. We celebrate the power of people coming together. That’s why we connect ambitious people abroad with their families and friends back home so they can support each other emotionally and financially, and lead more enriched lives.*
**Why Rebtel?**
 When you join Rebtel, you become part of a global team driven by a shared mission: to break down borders and build meaningful connects across the world. We take our work, and the people we build it for, seriously. Our Stockholm HQ reflects who we are: focused, collaborative and energized by a healthy dose of curiosity (and just the right amount of coffee).
   

  

**What will you do?**
 As a Product Designer at Rebtel you will bring strategic thinking and strong visual craft to the table. Someone who has the passion to turn real user needs into impactful, accessible and scalable design solutions. In this role, you will help shape intuitive user experience across mobile and web.
   

  

**Responsibilities And Tasks**
* Deliver and own high quality, user centered designs and features to elevate user experience as a whole.
* Partner with Senior Product Designer, Product Managers, and Engineers to iterate user experience from concept to launch.
* Create, collaborate and iterate on flows, prototypes and high-fidelity visuals.
* Contribute to evolving design system to support scalability across mobile app (iOS/Android) and web.
* Balance look and feel and user needs with business objectives and technical constraints.
* Ensure accessibility and usability standards are met across designs consistently.
* Build UI that supports localization requirements.
* Support research and testing to validate design decisions.
* Stay up to date with design and mobile app trends to inform design thinking and innovation.


**Requirements**
* Minimum of 3 years of experience in a similar role.
* Proficiency in Figma and similar tools for prototype, collaboration and documentation.
* Strong eye for visual and interaction design.
* Motion/interaction skills is a plus.
* Familiarity with front-end technologies (HTML/CSS/JavaScript) is a plus.
* Experience with user research, usability testing and A/B testing is a plus.
* Experience working in a rapidly changing environment.


**Our Offer To You**
**Benefits**
 At Rebtel, you are the most important asset and we strive to provide a comprehensive package of benefits and perks that enhance your well-being and work experience. Here are some of the things you can expect from us:
   

  

* Pension Plan
* Health Checkups and Private Medical Insurance
* 10k Bucket (net) for wellness allowance and Travel (benefit taxed)
* Discount on gym memberships
* Bonus program
* Parental pay
* 30 days annual vacation
* Relocation Support, if you're joining us from afar, we'll assist you in making a smooth transition.


 Rebtel is an international workplace, and at the office, we speak English; therefore, high English proficiency is required.
   

  

*We are Rebtel. We come from all around the world to create products for anyone who has crossed a border. We believe in equal opportunity and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.*
 Global migration is a 21st-century reality. Whether people are fleeing from something or racing towards better opportunity, following love or seeking new experiences, more and more are living in different environments and in new ways. We celebrate the power of people coming together. That’s why we connect ambitious people abroad with their families and friends back home so they can support each other emotionally and financially, and lead more enriched lives.
   

  

 Our ambitious team reflects our international audience. We are a diverse group of people from all over the world that come together every day—and we’re looking for others driven by the same desire to create meaningful products that bridge cultural and geographic distances.

title: UX/UI Designer Intern
description:
At Bending Spoons, we’re striving to build one of the all-time great companies. A company that serves a huge number of customers. A company where team members grow to their full potential. A company that functions at unparalleled levels of effectiveness and efficiency. A company that creates value for shareowners at an extraordinary rate. And a company that does so while adhering to high ethical standards.
   

  

 To achieve this objective, we execute the following strategy: We acquire a digital business with untapped potential and make it as successful as we can by leveraging our platform—which comprises our expertise, technologies, data, brand, talents, and company culture. Then, we invest the proceeds into making our platform more powerful, and into acquiring new businesses. Thus, our strategy sees us combine an investor’s attention to capital allocation with the hands-on approach of an operator.
   

  

 For a talented, driven, and collaborative individual, working at Bending Spoons is an opportunity to learn, make an impact, and progress their career at an exceptionally high rate. That’s our promise to such a candidate.
   

  

**A few examples of your responsibilities** 
* Help shape outstanding user experiences and impact the success of our products by creating flawless UI and UX designs, from conceptualization to delivery. You’ll take a human-first approach to designing products, ensuring they delight users by being as effective as they are aesthetically pleasing.
* Make use of prototyping tools to ensure your designs are intuitive and to explore new, innovative ways of designing interactions.
* Work closely with product managers and software engineers to propose new features and improve the quality of both mobile and desktop apps.
* Focus on user testing and research to ensure our customers are always at the core of our product designs.
* Find, together with engineers, the most efficient trade-off between high-value solutions for users and the complexity of implementation.
* Leverage usage data to evaluate the impact of your designs, and apply your learnings to the next iterations.


**What we look for** 
* **Reasoning ability.** 
 Given the necessary knowledge, you can solve complex problems. You think from first principles, and structure your ideas sharply. You resist the influence of biases. You identify and take care of the details that matter.
* **Drive.** 
 You’re extremely ambitious in everything you do—and your initiative, effort, and tenacity match the intensity of your ambition. You feel deeply responsible for your work. You hold yourself to a high—and rising—bar.
* **Team spirit.** 
 You give generously and without the expectation of receiving in return. You support the best idea, not your idea. You're always happy to get your hands dirty to help your team. You’re reliable, honest, and transparent.
* **Proficiency in English.** 
 You read, write, and speak proficiently in English.
* **You can work at least 20 hours per week.** 
 A full-time commitment is preferred, but we’ll consider applicants who can commit to at least 20 hours per week.


**What we offer** 
* **Incredibly talented, entrepreneurial teams.** 
 You’ll work in small, result-oriented, autonomous teams alongside some of the brightest people in your field.
* **An exceptional opportunity for growth.** 
 We go to great lengths to hire individuals of outstanding potential—then, our priority is to put them in the ideal position to thrive. Spooners in their 20s lead products worth hundreds of millions of dollars. And if you’ve got what it takes, you’ll soon be playing an essential role in major projects, too.
* **Competitive pay and access to equity in the company.** 
 Typically, we offer an individual at the start of their career a salary of £54,545 in the UK and €52,246 elsewhere. If they possess a few years of relevant experience, the salary on offer tends to be between £66,779 and £149,636 in the UK, and €63,965 and €143,330 elsewhere. Pay grows rapidly as you accumulate experience and translate it into greater impact. You can also receive some of your pay in company equity at a discounted price, thus participating in the value creation we achieve together. If relocating to Italy, you may enjoy a 50% tax cut.
* **All. These. Benefits.** 
 Flexible hours, remote working, unlimited backing for learning and training, top-of-the-market health insurance, a rich relocation package, generous parental support, and a yearly retreat to a stunning location. We help each Spooner set up the conditions to do their best work.


**Commitment & contract**
 Internship. Full-time or part-time.
   

  

**Location**
 Milan (Italy), London (UK) or remote.
   

  

**Before you apply**
 Bending Spoons is a demanding environment: We’re extremely ambitious and we hold ourselves—and one another—to a high standard. While this tends to lead to extraordinary learning, achievement, and career growth, it also requires significant commitment.
   

  

 To help you ramp up quickly and set yourself up for success, we recommend spending your first few months working from our Milan office, regardless of your long-term work location. It’s the best way to rapidly absorb our company culture and build trust with your new teammates. We’ll support you with generous travel and accommodation assistance.
   

  

 After that, you’re welcome to work from our offices in Milan or London, or remotely from approved countries—depending on what we agree at the offer stage.
   

  

 If the role speaks to you and you’re excited to give your best, we’d love to hear from you. Apply now—we can’t wait to meet you.
   

  

**The selection process**
 If you pass our screening, we’ll ask you to take on a few tests that assess how you approach unfamiliar problems. If you’re successful with those, we’ll invite you to a series of interviews.
   

  

 Bending Spoons is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We consider for employment any applicant and we provide reasonable accommodations for an applicant with disabilities, which can be requested through this form.
   

  

 Studies suggest that women tend not to apply for a job if their CV isn’t a perfect fit. Here, talent takes precedence over experience. So if you like the role and think you could be awesome at it in time, go ahead and apply.

title: UX/UI Designer
description:

Then, we invest the proceeds into making our platform more powerful, and into acquiring new businesses. Thus, our strategy sees us combine an investor’s attention to capital allocation with the hands-on approach of an operator.

* Help shape outstanding user experiences and impact the success of our products by creating flawless UI and UX designs, from conceptualization to delivery. You’ll take a human-first approach to designing products, ensuring they delight users by being as effective as they are aesthetically pleasing.
* Make use of prototyping tools to ensure your designs are intuitive and to explore new, innovative ways of designing interactions.
* Work closely with product managers and software engineers to propose new features and improve the quality of both mobile and desktop apps.
* Focus on user testing and research to ensure our customers are always at the core of our product designs.

 Given the necessary knowledge, you can solve complex problems. You think from first principles, and structure your ideas sharply. You resist the influence of biases. You identify and take care of the details that matter.

title: Brand Designer
description:
**About Us**
 At Legora, we’re on a mission to transform the way lawyers work. Our AI-native platform lets legal professionals enhance their productivity and automate complex workflows. We collaborate closely with our clients and iterate at a market-leading pace. In a year, we have gone from an early MVP to tools used daily by thousands of lawyers, and are now scaling rapidly. We are here to win together with our team and clients, and carry the belief that life is too short not to accomplish something truly special.
   

  

 You are joining an early stage scale-up with exceptional product-market fit, trusted by global leaders like Bird & Bird, Pérez-Llorca, and Mannheimer Swartling. Backed by over $100M in funding from top investors including Benchmark, ICONIQ, Redpoint, and Y Combinator. And a a world-class team from Google, Klarna, Spotify, and top tier law firms with infinite room to grow professionally.
   

  

 The role
   

  

 As a Brand Designer on the Design team, you will help scale and systematize how Legora shows up in the world. You’ll create visual assets across channels—campaigns, events, social, ads—and build the systems that make high-quality brand work fast and repeatable. You’ll work closely with other world-class designers, as well as stakeholders in Marketing, to bring creative ideas to life.
   

  

 We’re looking for a Brand Designer who cares deeply about crafting standout experiences and wants to reimagine legal work for the AI era.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
* Lead design execution for marketing campaigns
* Design visuals for campaigns, ads, landing pages, events, and social
* Collaborate with Marketing and other designers to ensure high-quality, cohesive execution at scale
* Create and templatize assets across paid, organic, and owned channels
* Use motion and animation to bring visuals to life


 Who you are
   

  

* A strong visual designer with experience across digital and physical marketing and brand systems
* Portfolio that shows expert visuals, craft, motion work, and range across formats
* Skilled at turning one-off executions into scalable templates and systems
* Hands-on, fast-moving, and comfortable working across multiple surfaces in a self-guided manner
* Expert in tools like Figma (including new features like Figma Buzz), Illustrator, and After Effects
* Experience designing for B2B or tech companies
* Early adopter of AI tools to accelerate creative workflows


 What's in it for you
   

  

* Career development opportunities in a rapidly evolving entrepreneurial environment.
* Direct collaboration with senior leadership and the opportunity to directly impact company growth and strategy.
* A collaborative, high-energy team environment where your ideas and contributions are valued and implemented.
* Competitive salary complemented with a transparent and highly competitive options program.
* Centrally located offices in Stockholm, designed as a space for you to do your life's work.


**We founded Legora to empower lawyers with the tools they truly deserve.**
 We’re not building for the way law is practiced today - we’re reimagining how it will be practiced tomorrow.

 We’re looking for a Web Designer with
 **exceptional** 
 Framer skills and a strong eye for design—someone who thrives on execution and wants to push the boundaries of how a B2B brand shows up online.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
* Design and build pages in Framer, ranging from product overviews, content articles, customer case studies, and more
* Build out a scalable CMS in Framer to enable other teams to move faster
* Create layouts that are responsive, performant, and visually polished
* Collaborate closely with marketing, product, and other designers to tell a cohesive story
* Write custom code when needed to extend Framer beyond built-in capabilities
* Develop reusable components and web patterns to scale our site with consistency


 Who you are
   

  

* A strong visual designer with a sharp eye for typography, layout, and storytelling
* Exceptionally experienced in Framer, with a portfolio that demonstrates hands-on mastery
* Able to take projects from idea to shipped page independently
* A portfolio that shows live web work with strong aesthetic and UX thinking
* Experience designing for B2B or tech companies
* Early adopter of AI tools to accelerate creative workflows

title: Art Director
description:
Established in 2004,
 **OLIVER** 
 is the world’s first and only specialist in designing, building, and running bespoke in-house agencies and marketing ecosystems for brands. We partner with over 300 clients in 40+ countries and counting. Our unique model drives creativity and efficiency, allowing us to deliver tailored solutions that resonate deeply with audiences.
   

  

 As a part of
 **The Brandtech Group** 
 , we're at the forefront of leveraging cutting-edge AI technology to revolutionise how we create and deliver work. Our
 **AI solutions** 
 enhance efficiency, spark creativity, and drive insightful decision-making, empowering our teams to produce innovative and impactful results.
   

  

**Role:** 
 Art Director
   

  

**Location:** 
 Stockholm, Sweden
   

  

**About the role:**
 We are collaborating with a global leader in the drinks and beverages industry to recruit a talented Art Director. We're seeking an experienced creative visionary with over 5 years of experience in advertising, a strong background in art direction, and a passion for AI in creative processes. In this role, you'll collaborate across functions with a dynamic team of 15 professionals and contribute to ground-breaking campaigns that push creative boundaries.
   

  

**What you will be doing:**
* Create and manage original, persuasive, conceptually compelling work for campaigns, content, and experiences with support from the Creative Director.
* Working proactive to push the brands to explore new creative expressions.
* Collaborate with on-site and in-house teams to explore ways to develop creative presence through innovative content.
* Develop creative output that is on-brand, innovative, challenging and attuned to the cultural interests of the audience.
* Ensure all concepts follow responsible communication guidelines.
* Help develop content calendars that support and extend marketing initiatives, identifying the most effective methods and channels for each sub-section of the target audience.
* Identify and build relationships with and bringing to fruition, collaborative projects with partner platforms, websites, influencers, and channels which, can extend the reach of the content and help deliver authentic experiences to the target audience.
* Supervise the teams to be an arbiter of best practices in terms of messaging, strategic targeting, and style.
* Work with the data and analytics teams to gauge content effectiveness and make recommendations based on those results.
* Demonstrated understanding and application of AI in creative processes, with a forward-thinking mindset towards emerging technologies.
* Fluent in Swedish and English


**What you need to be great in this role:** 
  

  

* Extensive experience working with both luxury and commercial brands.
* Experience in consumer goods, luxury, or drinks & beverages sectors preferred.
* In-depth knowledge of fashion and lifestyle industries, with experience directing visual narratives.
* Demonstrated success leading and executing international campaigns for high-profile clients.
* Skill in developing tailored aesthetic concepts that resonate with sophisticated audiences.
* A helicopter view of the content world and emerging trends in social media communication.
* Hands-on design experience at leading creative studios.
* Strong foundation in graphic design and visual communication principles.
* Proven ability to co-create with photographers, stylists, partners, and fellow art directors.
* Experience managing end-to-end creative processes, from brand identity to campaign development.
* Expertise in motion-driven content creation and execution.
* Excellent portfolio of work that demonstrates high quality art direction and design within a variety of marketing campaign and platform projects.
* Strong layout and design skills across print and digital.
* Actively support the Creative Director with new business activity, networking and pitching where required.
* Experienced in liaising directly with the client and the ability to build strong relationships.
* Experience with strategic brainstorming, creative brief development, and creative execution.
* Experience meeting clients and presenting your work.
* Ability to think creatively and justify concepts to clients and team members.
* A helicopter view of the content world as well as emerging trends in social media communication
* A deep understanding of Editorial & Publishing models.
* A developed and working awareness of all major content platforms and channels and a view on new platforms.
* Experience in consumer goods, luxury, or drinks & beverages sectors preferred.
* 5+ years of relevant experience in
+ Digital
+ Print
+ Motion Graphics
+ Web Design
+ UX-UI
+ Artwork
+ Production


 Req ID: 13318
   

  

 Our values shape everything we do:
   

  

 Be
 **Ambitious** 
 to succeed
   

  

 Be
 **Imaginative** 
 to push the boundaries of what’s possible
   

  

 Be
 **Inspirational** 
 to do groundbreaking work
   

  

 Be
 **always learning and listening** 
 to understand
   

  

 Be
 **Results-focused** 
 to exceed expectations
   

  

 Be
 **actively pro-inclusive and anti-racist** 
 across our community, clients and creations
   

  

*OLIVER,* 
*a part of the Brandtech Group, is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating an inclusive working environment where all employees are encouraged to reach their full potential, and individual differences are valued and respected. All applicants shall be considered for employment without regard to race, ethnicity, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, neurodivergence, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by local laws.*
*OLIVER has set ambitious environmental goals around sustainability, with science-based emissions reduction targets. Collectively, we work towards our mission, embedding sustainability into every department and through every stage of the project lifecycle.*

 As a Motion Designer on the Design team, you will bring the Legora brand to life through motion, animation, and storytelling. You’ll craft motion systems that scale across channels—product marketing, social, campaigns, ads, and events—and help define how we use movement to communicate clearly and feel alive. You’ll work closely with Marketing to concept, build, and ship compelling creative work that captures attention and elevates our brand in a B2B context.
   

  

 We’re looking for a motion designer with strong execution skills and a sharp design eye—someone who sees motion as a tool for clarity, emotion, and momentum.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
* Design and animate motion assets for product launches, campaigns, social, explainers, and ads
* Build a scalable motion system and toolkit to ensure quality and consistency at speed
* Support major product launches with high-quality motion
* Collaborate with Marketing and other designers to explore and ship motion-driven work


 Who you are
   

  

* A motion-first designer with a strong foundation in visual design and storytelling
* Portfolio that showcases high-quality motion work across brand, product, and marketing
* Expert in tools like After Effects, Premiere, Illustrator, and Figma
* Comfortable working fast and iterating based on feedback
* Experience designing for B2B or tech companies
* Early adopter of AI tools to accelerate creative workflows


 What's in it for you
   

  

* Career development opportunities in a rapidly evolving entrepreneurial environment.
* Direct collaboration with senior leadership and the opportunity to directly impact company growth and strategy.
* A collaborative, high-energy team environment where your ideas and contributions are valued and implemented.
* Competitive salary complemented with a transparent and highly competitive options program.
* Centrally located offices in Stockholm, designed as a space for you to do your life's work.


**We founded Legora to empower lawyers with the tools they truly deserve.**
 We’re not building for the way law is practiced today - we’re reimagining how it will be practiced tomorrow.

title: Product manager – Machine and Equipment Tracking
description:
**Are you ready to shape the future of smart asset tracking across Europe?** 
 At ABAX, we help businesses with mobile workforces work smarter — cutting costs, improving efficiency, and driving sustainability. Now, we’re growing fast and looking for a Product Manager to take full ownership of one of our most exciting product areas: Machine & Equipment Tracking.
   

  

 As
 **Product Manager,** 
 you’ll sit at the heart of an empowered, cross-functional team — defining strategy, guiding execution, and owning outcomes. This is your chance to lead a product that blends IoT innovation with tangible, real-world impact. From construction tools to heavy machinery, you’ll help businesses track and manage assets with precision and intelligence.
   

  

 We’re seeking someone with a strong, hands-on product management background — ideally with experience aligning product strategy to commercial goals. You know how to balance user needs, technical feasibility, and business value — and you're passionate about creating products that drive growth and customer success.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Define and lead the product strategy in alignment with ABAX’s broader goals
* Leverage data and market insights to identify customer pain points and solve real problems
* Drive the product lifecycle end to end — from concept to launch and beyond
* Collaborate closely with engineering, UX, and commercial teams
* Own and iterate the product roadmap — delivering value early and often
* Create clear, outcome-focused user stories and champion seamless user experiences


**What You Bring**
* Proven experience scaling B2B cloud products as a Product Manager
* A relevant degree in technology, engineering, or a related field
* Solid understanding of both hardware and software, ideally with insight into the machine & equipment domain
* Enthusiastic, innovative, customer-obsessed, and sustainability-minded
* A collaborative mindset and the ability to work across discipline


**What You’ll Gain**
* End-to-end ownership of a rapidly scaling product
* A visible, influential role shaping product development and company impact
* Opportunity to work with scalable solutions and future-ready technology
* A strong company culture based on accountability, trust, and teamwork


**Other Information**
* Start date: As soon as possible
* Work extent: Full-time
* Location: Stockholm. Hybrid working available.


**Background check and Reference verification:**
 Successful employment is contingent upon ABAX receiving satisfactory references.
   

  

 As part of our hiring process, we perform a digital reference check through RefApp, an advanced online solution for managing this procedure.
   

  

 Please be aware that a background check may be conducted simultaneously with the reference check.
   

  

**Equal Opportunities:**
 At ABAX, we are dedicated to creating an inclusive environment for all our colleagues. This commitment extends to ensuring that our recruitment practices and processes are as inclusive as possible. We encourage applicants from all backgrounds to join us in strengthening our focus on equality and diversity in the workplace.
   

  

**About ABAX:**
