 ABAX is a leading European telematics IoT platform offering connected mobility solutions for vehicle tracking, tool tracking, and equipment control. Our mission is to deliver mobility data insights that empower people to do more with less.
   

  

 With over 500,000 tracked assets and 40,000 customers, ABAX delivers reliable and powerful solutions for businesses relying on physical operations. Our advanced platform transforms customer needs into actionable insights and automated reporting, driving efficiency and operational excellence.
   

  

 We operate across Europe, with close to 300 employees working from our facilities in Norway, Sweden, Denmark, Finland, the Netherlands, Belgium, Poland, and the UK. Our Head Office is in Larvik, Norway.

title: Senior Enterprisearkitekt - strategisk förändringsledning
description:
*Är du en erfaren enterprisearkitekt och förändringsledare med en stark förmåga att driva strategiska IT-transformationer i komplexa organisationer? Vill du bidra till utvecklingen av framtidens verksamhet och skapa verkligt värde för kunder i en dynamisk och utmanande miljö? Länsförsäkringar AB söker nu en enterprisearkitekt med fokus på strategisk förändringsledning. Låter det intressant? Läs vidare!*
**Om jobbet**
 I rollen är ditt huvudsakliga uppdrag att skapa tydlighet och samsyn mellan affärsstrategier och implementationslösningar i nära samverkan med affärschefer, leveransansvariga, affärsutvecklare, arkitekter och ledningsgrupper. Du leder samarbetet med att omsätta verksamhetens mål och strategier till exekverbara målarkitekturer och roadmaps, samtidigt som du engagerar och guidar organisationen genom involvering och förändringsledning.
   

  

 Exempel på arbetsuppgifter:
   

  

* Vara strategisk partner till ledningsgrupper och affärsområden, med fokus på att realisera verksamhetens mål och strategier
* Driva och stötta stora utvecklingsprogram och transformativa projekt - från strategi till genomförande
* Säkerställa att framtagna lösningar är hållbara, skalbara och väl förankrade i verksamheten
* Bidra till att utveckla och etablera effektiva arbetssätt, processer och riktlinjer för förändrings- och utvecklingsprojekt
* Skapa och upprätthålla starka relationer i en stor och komplex organisation med federativ struktur


**Vem är du?**
 För att bli framgångsrik i rollen ser vi att du har en masterexamen inom ekonomi, management eller civilingenjör. Vidare har du:
   

  

* Minst 5 års erfarenhet som enterprisearkitekt med ansvar som täcker flera affärsenheter
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av att leda förändring i stora organisationer med komplexa IT-komponenter
* Erfarenhet av leveransansvar av betydande storlek
* Stor vana att samverka med affärsansvariga på CxO-nivå i stora företag/koncerner
* Minst 3 års erfarenhet av agila eller produktorienterade leveransstrukturer


 Erfarenhet från branscher som bank, försäkring och pension är starkt meriterande. Har du dessutom arbetat som managementkonsult är även det fördelaktigt.
   

  

 Som person är du driven, lösningsorienterad och trivs i analytiska och samarbetsinriktade roller. Du är skicklig på att skapa förtroende, engagera stakeholders och att leda förändring genom ett inkluderande och samarbetsorienterat arbetssätt.
   

  

**Om oss**
 På Länsförsäkringar AB arbetar vi för att driva hela länsförsäkringsgruppens digitala utveckling framåt – i nära samverkan med våra 23 länsbolag och koncernens affärsenheter.
   

  

 Du välkomnas till avdelningen Digital förflyttning & Arkitektur. Vår funktion skapar förutsättningar för att lyckas med förändring i både verksamheten och inom IT, och säkerställer att utvecklingsportföljerna ligger i linje med koncernens strategiska mål. Vi har ett normativt ansvar för våra digitala kanaler samt ett funktionellt ansvar för områden som kundupplevelse (CX och UX), enterprisearkitektur och kundmötesarkitektur. Vi brinner för att lösa komplexa utmaningar tillsammans – och vi utvecklas ständigt som förändringsledare i ett starkt samverkande team.
   

  

 Hos oss får du chansen att påverka och leda strategiska initiativ som gör verklig skillnad – både för verksamheten och för våra kunders vardag.
   

  

**Mer information**
*Låter det spännande? Då vill vi veta mer om dig! Välkommen med din ansökan redan idag. Vi arbetar löpande med denna rekrytering och kan komma att tillsätta tjänsten innan sista ansökningsdag.*
***Observera att svarstiden för denna rekryteringsprocess kan vara längre än vanligt, detta på grund av semestertider. Vi uppskattar ditt tålamod och kommer att återkomma så snart som möjligt.***
**Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-07-28**

title: Senior Engineering Manager - Web Systems
description:
**Why join us?**
 We’re on a mission to empower people with disabilities to do what they once did or never thought possible. As the world-leader in assistive communication solutions, we empower our customers to express themselves, connect with the world, and live richer lives.
   

  

 At Tobii Dynavox, you can grow your career within a dynamic, global company that has a clear, impactful purpose - with the flexibility to also do what truly matters to you outside of work. What’s more, you’ll be part of a work culture where collaboration is the norm and individuality is welcomed.
   

  

 As a member of our team, you’ll have the power to innovate for good. You’ll see your ideas in use in new applications, work with the latest technology on leading platforms, and deliver meaningful solutions for our customers.
   

  

**About the Role:**
*We’re at an exciting stage in our journey—growing rapidly and expanding our Product & Development team in Stockholm to build a vibrant hub for innovation, product design, and technology. This is a unique opportunity to join a thriving organization where you can help shape the future of assistive communication, defining how we work and delivering impactful solutions for our users.*
*We are building a culture of empowered, collaborative teams who are passionate about helping individuals with disabilities find their voice and connect with the world. Our teams thrive on trust, collaboration, and a positive environment where everyone lead and contributes. We deeply understand the people we serve, empathize with their challenges, and use our expertise to make a real difference.*
 The
 **Senior Engineering Manager** 
 for Web Systems (Recommender Journey) is responsible for the work of a newly created team which will own the comprehensive web experience for users of Tobii Dynavox products. It will be used by professionals as well as people in informal care circles who work to serve users of our solutions. The Senior Engineering Manager for Web Systems (Recommender Journey) will lead this team to define, architect, implement and maintain this ecosystem, thus ensuring its long-term contribution to our product offerings.
   

  

**In this role, you will**
* Lead, mentor, and inspire a team of highly competent software engineers.
* Lead the definition of the architecture which supports the overarching web experience with respect to the individual products and services.
* Oversee the design, development, and deployment of the web experience using React and other front-end technologies, but with a C#/.NET back end.
* Establish and maintain high quality design and development processes.
* Maintain high reliability and availability of the products.
* Collaborate with peers in the engineering department to ensure the architectural integrity of the entire portfolio.
* Drive continuous improvements in development processes, tools, and methodologies.


**What We're Looking For**
* Minimum of five years development experience.
* Minimum of four years management experience.
* Significant experience in C#/.NET
* Significant experience in Web development
* Expert in Agile/Scrum
* Able to contribute to architectural discussions/decisions
* Demonstrated experience with and sensitivity to UX design concerns.
* Strong leadership experience and excellent communication skills
* Proficient in providing and receiving feedback in a supportive manner.


***Please note that our recruitment process may take a bit longer than usual during July and August due to the holiday period. We appreciate your patience and will get back to you as soon as possible. Wishing you a lovely summer!***
 Apply today!
   

  

 We believe in empowering individuals - including our own employees - to reach their full potential. So, if you want to change lives while growing your own career, we’d love to hear from you.

title: Software Engineer
description:
**We’re Hiring:** Senior Backend Engineer (Java)
  
**Location:** Hybrid
  
**Experience Level:** 7+ Years
  
**Job Type:** Full-Time
  
Are you a seasoned Backend Engineer with deep expertise in Java development and modern backend architecture? Do you thrive in solving complex technical challenges and building scalable systems that power real-world products?
  
If yes, we want you on our team!
  
What You’ll Do
  
Design, develop, and maintain robust backend systems using Java (Spring Boot, Jakarta EE)
  
Build scalable RESTful APIs and microservices for high-performance applications
  
Collaborate with frontend developers, DevOps engineers, and product teams to deliver end-to-end solutions
  
Optimize existing services for performance, reliability, and scalability
  
Mentor junior developers and contribute to technical design reviews
  
Work with databases (SQL & NoSQL), messaging systems (e.g., Kafka, RabbitMQ), and containerized environments (Docker/Kubernetes)
  
  

✅ What We’re Looking For
  
7+ years of professional backend development experience
  
Strong proficiency in Java, with experience in Spring Boot or similar frameworks
  
Solid understanding of RESTful architecture, API design, and microservices
  
Experience with relational and NoSQL databases (e.g., PostgreSQL, MongoDB)
  
Good grasp of software design patterns, clean code practices, and TDD
  
Exposure to CI/CD pipelines, Docker, and Kubernetes is a strong plus
  
Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP) is an advantage
  
Excellent problem-solving and communication skills
  
  

What We Offer
  
Competitive salary and performance-based bonuses
  
Flexible work environment
  
Opportunity to work on impactful, large-scale projects
  
Continuous learning and growth support
  
Collaborative and high-performance engineering culture
  
  

Ready to Apply?
  
Send your CV and a brief introduction to info@tecvinson.com
  
**Use subject line:** Senior Java Backend Engineer – [Your Name]
  
We look forward to building something great with you!
  
#Hiring #JavaDeveloper #BackendEngineer #SpringBoot #Microservices #SoftwareEngineering #TechJobs

title: IT-projektledare inom applikationsutveckling
description:
IT projektledaren skall ansvara för att driva de tekniska frågorna och kan omfatta både nyutveckling eller vidareutveckling av egenutvecklade applikationer, samt konfiguration och integration av inköpta applikationer.


Applikationerna hanterar och bearbetare stora datamängder för att möjliggöra planering av det svenska transmissionsnätet samt utbyte av data med de nordiska systemoperatörerna. Då verksamheten har höga säkerhetskrav arbetar vi med on-prem lösningar.


Arbete drivs i programmet i tätt samarbete med programledare, test-ledare, IT-arkitekt samt övriga projektledare. Du kommer kunna ta del av tidigare gjort arbete inom området samt gjorda erfarenheter från andra länder i projektarbetet för att kunna utvärdera och implementera bra lösningar.


Projektledaren kommer att arbeta tillsammans med interna resurser och agila team inom IT och verksamhet. Du är ansvarig för den tekniska framdriften och rapporterar löpande till programledaren. Som stöd har du projektmodellen PPS som i delar är anpassad till Svenska kraftnäts behov. Utöver PPS styrs vi som statligt affärsverk av riktlinjer, anvisningar och instruktioner.


Du kommer att tillhöra avdelningen IT för Kraftsystem & Elmarknad, som är en avdelning på IT-divisionen.  



**I uppdraget ingår följande arbetsuppgifter:**

* Du leder arbetet med att ta fram underlag för beslut samt planer för genomförande av aktiviteter som stödjer de behov som identifieras under arbetet för att stödja övriga leveranser i programmet.
* Du samordnar dialogen med IT förvaltningen vid införandet av nya lösningar.
* Du leder projektmedarbetare, samt koordinerar interna agila utvecklingsteam för att leverera inom tid, kostnad och resultat gentemot effektägare och styrgrupp.
* Du kommer att driva och hålla samman säkerhetsfrågor i samarbete med säkerhetsavdelningen för att programmet och Svk skall efterleva de höga krav på informations- och IT-säkerhet som ställs på leveranser
* Du säkerställer koordinering av aktiviteter gentemot intressenter inom Svenska kraftnäts organisation och inom programmet
* Du säkerställer koordinering av aktiviteter gentemot de nordiska organisationerna samt det gemensamma kontoret i Köpenhamn
* Du kommer att rapportera till programledare och styrgrupp
* Du kan behöva leda förstudie i förhållande till programmet eller andra delar inom IT
* Du planerar och överför projektets arbetssätt och resultat till IT förvaltningen innan avslut av projektet

title: IT Security Specialist
company_industry: Paper and Forest Product Manufacturing and Packaging and Containers Manufacturing
description:
**Job Description**
 At Billerud we believe that when we have tomorrow in mind, we will do our very best today. It is thanks to our employees that we are a world-leading company within the field of renewable paper and packaging materials. Do you want to realize your true value and work for a sustainable tomorrow? Join us!
   

  

**Join us as an IT Security Specialist**
 This autumn, we are expanding our Network & Security team and are looking for both junior and senior IT Security Specialists to join us at one of our Swedish locations.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As an IT Security Specialist at Billerud, you will be part of a growing and dedicated team working to ensure the protection and resilience of our IT infrastructure. Depending on your experience and interests, your responsibilities may include:
   

  

* Performing vulnerability assessments, risk analyses and incident investigations
* Work with our security solutions and data recovery procedures
* Supporting the development and implementation of security policies and procedures
* Monitoring and optimizing security infrastructure
* Make sure agreements are up to date and that licenses follows business needs
* Participating in or leading IT security-related projects
* Acting as a security advisor in IT and business projects
* Support and collaborate Service Managers & SPOC to deliver on business needs.


 You will report to the Manager of IT Network & Security and be based onsite at one of our Swedish units: Gävle, Skärblacka, Frövi, Gruvön, Karlsborg (Kalix) or at our head office in Solna, Stockholm.
   

  

**Overtime, on-call duty and travel in service within Sweden and potentially to north America may occur occasionally.**
 At Billerud, we put Safety First. Together we take great pride in our responsibility to contribute to a safe work environment. Please read more about our Safety First initiative
   

  

**Qualifications**
 We welcome applications from both experienced professionals and those early in their careers. To succeed in this role, you should have:
   

  

* A degree in IT security or equivalent experience
* A strong interest in cybersecurity and a proactive mindset
* Good understanding of IT infrastructure and security principles
* Strong communication skills in Swedish and English
* A structured, analytical, and collaborative approach to work


**Workplace & conditions**
* This is an onsite position at one of our Swedish locations. Hybrid work is possible in line with our company policy (up to 2 remote days per week or depending on project needs).
* Please note: We do not offer relocation packages and applicants requires a valid Swedish work permit


**Personal qualities**
 Personlity is important for us. To thrive in this role, we believe you have a strong sense for responsibility showcasing in ability to prioritize, take initiatives and ability to keep focus when working both in teams and independently. You enjoy yourself in contexts demanding flexibility since the IT security area is constantly evolving, both in general and within Billerud. Nevertheless, you also understand and prioritize the importance of documentation.
   

  

 Our values are very important for us and we believe that you recognize yourself in: We care for each other and We do what we say.
   

  

**Contact**
 If you want to know more about the position, you are welcome to contact Åke Olsson, Senior Manager Global IT Network & Security at ake.olsson@billerud.com. If you want to know more about the recruitment process, you are welcome to contact Julia Åkerlund, Talent Acquisition Partner, at julia.akerlund@billerud.com.
   

  

**Due to the holiday season, feedback and communication may take longer than usual during the summer period. We appreciate your patience and understanding.**
 We decline proposals from external recruitment providers.
   

  

**Application information**
**Selection will occur on ongoing basis and the position might be filled during the application period.**
 Billerud is an equal opportunity employer. We embrace diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees and candidates.
   

  

**Why us?**
* Join both a local and a global team of skilled professionals!
* An opportunity to contribute to a more sustainable future
* Development and career opportunities
* Performance-based bonus, occupational pension and a number of different benefits according to company policy.
* Opportunity to hybrid working according to company standard.


**Our recruitment process** 
 will include interviews, recruitment test and reference checks. Final candidate will require a negative alcohol- & drug test as well as background checks.
   

  

**Do you want to help create a sustainable future through your work?**
 At Billerud, we are fully committed to reduce our and our customers carbon footprint by offering high-performance paper and packaging materials. We are convinced that the right solutions can be important tools to help fight climate change. That's why we see it as our responsibility to enable the best packaging choices, for a better tomorrow.
   

  

 Our proud history in the forestry and paper industry goes back more than 150 years. Since then, we’ve grown to what we are today: a world leading company in high-performing paper and packaging materials - passionately committed to sustainability, quality, and customer value. Our materials are the basis of packaging and paper products used by millions of people around the world, 24 hours a day, all year round.
   

  

 We serve customers in more than 100 countries through our three business areas Liquid Packaging Board, Paper and Paper Board. Our nine production units are located in Sweden, USA, and Finland and we have around 6,000 employees in 19 countries. Our annual turnover is approximately SEK 43.5 billion and the share is listed on Nasdaq Stockholm. At Billerud we always put safety first, care for each other, and do what we say.
   

  

**Join us in redefining sustainable packaging and drive meaningful change for a better tomorrow.**

title: Content Coordinator
description:
At Nissan, we're not just building cars, we're revolutionizing mobility. We believe that every individual possesses a unique set of skills and passions that can be harnessed to drive innovation and shape the future of the automotive industry. Our global impact is fueled by dedicated minds, crafting and delivering innovation since 1933. For over 90 years, our core belief in doing what others don't has driven innovation and excitement for our customers, shaping Nissan into the business it is today. We are not just a company - we're a movement, pushing boundaries and embracing the spirit of "Defy Ordinary".
   

  

 As a
 **Content Coordinator** 
 within the newly created RBU (Belgium, The Netherlands, Norway, Denmark, Sweden), you will play a pivotal role in managing and aligning content strategies for national and retail campaigns across a specific region. Reporting to the Content Section Manager, you will bridge the gap between central directives and local market requirements, ensuring a cohesive and impactful campaign execution. This role demands a 360° marketing approach, leveraging data-driven insights, collaboration with cross-functional teams, and fostering a spirit of teamwork within the content team.
   

  

**How you can contribute and have an impact?**
**Campaign Management & Localization:**
* Develop and implement 360° marketing campaigns (national and retail) in alignment with central strategies and guidelines.
* Brief external agencies to create assets that meet central input while addressing the unique needs of local markets.
* Localize assets to resonate with regional audiences, ensuring alignment with cultural and market-specific nuances.
* Monitor the implementation of campaigns from an assets perspective to ensure consistency and quality and budget overall follow up for all production of content and agencies Creative Development:
* Collaborate with the central creative team to adapt or develop region-specific creative ideas and content.
* Drive the development of innovative content solutions to address specific market challenges and opportunities.
* Accompany and coach the creative agency within the new set-up and way of working, ensuring that the brand's "Defy Ordinary" philosophy is applied at all stages of the creative process.
* Champion new formats, technologies, and storytelling techniques tailored to regional audiences.
* Ensure aligned co-agency briefing and content development (national, retail, CRM, SoMe).


**Data-Driven Localization:**
* Use data insights and market analytics to define local specifications for campaigns and content.
* Work closely with local sales teams and business analysts to tailor content strategies for optimal impact.
* Ensure that local market needs are protected while seeking synergies across multiple markets.


**Social Media Content Management:**
* Develop and maintain a regional social media content calendar, ensuring alignment with global strategies and local relevance.
* Oversee the localization and development of SoMe content, ensuring high engagement and brand consistency.


**Performance Monitoring & Optimization:**
* Track the performance of campaigns and content, using data to refine and optimize strategies.
* Ensure that all content aligns with brand guidelines and delivers measurable business results.


****What we look for:****
* Strong understanding of 360° marketing strategies, particularly in the automotive industry.
* In-depth knowledge of Nordic country-specific digital marketing channels, platforms, tools and best practices.
* Exceptional briefing and communication skills, with the ability to convey central input to agencies effectively.
* Analytical mindset with the ability to interpret data and translate insights into actionable content strategies.
* Creativity and adaptability to develop bespoke content for diverse market needs.
* Collaborative approach with the ability to balance central directives and local requirements.
* Proficiency in social media management and content calendar planning.
* Bachelor's or Master's degree in Marketing, Communications, Business, or a related field.
* 5+ years of experience in content management, campaign development, or marketing roles, preferably in the automotive sector.
* Experience managing external agencies and briefing on campaign development.
* Proven track record of creating and localizing multi-market campaigns.
* Strong project management skills with the ability to manage multiple stakeholders and deadlines.
* Fluency in English and a Nordic language (Norwegian, Swedish or Danish) is a must.


 This is an exciting opportunity to lead and shape the content strategy for a dynamic region in a global automotive brand. You will work at the intersection of creativity and data, collaborating with talented professionals across markets while making a tangible impact on localized marketing success.
   

  

 Note: This job description serves as a general overview of the responsibilities and requirements for the position of Content Coordinator. Duties may evolve and change over time, and additional tasks may be assigned as deemed necessary by the company.
   

  

 Nissan believes the power comes from the inside, the diversity and well-being of its employees is key to success. People are our most valuable assets, and diversity and inclusion are the key to maximizing the power of each individual member of our team. Nissan is committed to be a truly diverse, equitable, and inclusive company that empowers everyone to bring their best, most authentic selves to work. Respecting each person, their opinions and value is when we can drive innovations that make a difference.
   

  

 Our future vision and ambition is "Together We Empower Mobility and Beyond" for a cleaner, safer and more inclusive world.
   

  

 Amsterdam Netherlands

title: Customer Web Manager
description:
**Role:** 
 Customer Web Manager
   

  

**Location:** 
 Stockholm (In-office)
   

  

**Company:** 
 360Player
   

  

**Job Type:** 
 Full-time
   

  

**Join the Global Leader in Sports Technology**
 At 360Player, we are redefining how sports clubs operate, develop players, and manage teams. As the world’s leading all-in-one Club Operating System, we help clubs streamline every aspect of their operations—from scheduling and payments to player development and video analytics. Trusted by top clubs such as Rush Soccer, FC Barcelona, and Rafa Nadal Academy, our platform is transforming the sports world. With offices in Stockholm, Barcelona, and the US, we’re looking for passionate, driven individuals to join our team as we continue to grow globally.
   

  

**About The Role**
 This is
 *not* 
 a pure coding role. It is a
 **hybrid technical and customer-facing role** 
 where you will help our global clients achieve success by building and maintaining their club websites while advising them on structure, integrations, and best practices.
   

  

 You will be in
 **regular meetings with clients, understanding their needs, translating those needs into effective digital solutions, and ensuring their websites and integrations drive results.** 
 You will own the process end-to-end: discovery, advising, building, and launching.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Lead discovery meetings with clients to understand their goals, structure, and digital needs
* Advise clients on best practices for website structure, design, and 360Player integrations
* Build and maintain client websites using Duda and Webflow, utilizing HTML, CSS, and JavaScript when necessary
* Integrate the 360Player platform into client websites and workflows
* Manage projects with a structured, proactive approach to deliver high-quality solutions on time
* Contribute to internal digital projects and SEO efforts as needed
* Be the technical expert that clients trust for implementation and ongoing improvements


**What We’re Looking For**
* 3+ years of experience in web development or technical consulting with a customer-facing component
* Comfortable leading meetings and advising clients on digital strategy
* Strong skills in HTML, CSS, and JavaScript with experience in CMS platforms like Duda and Webflow
* A good design eye and understanding of responsive, user-friendly web design
* Structured, reliable, and able to own projects end-to-end
* Experience with e-commerce, integrations, or platform-based projects is a plus
* Fluent in English, both spoken and written


**Personal Qualities**
* Confident and clear communicator
* Service-minded and solution-focused
* Enjoys working with clients to understand their needs and deliver results
* Business-oriented with a creative approach to challenges
* Thrives in a fast-paced, collaborative environment


**Why 360Player?**
* Be part of a fast-growing company with opportunities for advancement
* Work with global clients on meaningful digital projects
* Flexible work environment with room for creativity and ownership
* Help shape the digital presence of top sports organizations worldwide


**How To Apply**
 If you’re excited about combining your technical skills with client-facing consulting to make an impact, we’d love to hear from you. Please apply with your
 **resume and a short cover letter** 
 explaining why you’re the right fit for this hybrid role. We review applications on a rolling basis – don’t wait to apply!

title: Enhetschef IT-arkitektur
description:
*Att bygga och sköta om vägar och infrastruktur är stort. Att bidra till samhällsutvecklingen är ännu större. Hos oss får du göra både och. Nu söker vi en Enhetschef till vår IT-arkitekturenhet. Vi kombinerar det lilla företagets gemenskap och lagkänsla med det stora miljardföretagets stabilitet. Här får du möjlighet att utvecklas som en specialist på väg - med engagemang, samarbete och ansvar.*
 Ditt uppdrag som Enhetschef för IT-arkitekturenheten
   

  

 Ditt uppdrag som chef och ledare är att driva en IT-arkitekturenhet som levererar tidsenlig arkitektur, utgöra bollplank och kvalitetssäkra målarkitektur och utveckling av tjänster och produkter för ett robust och tillgängligt IT-landskap.
   

  

 Som enhetschef inom IT hos Svevia kommer du att ha en central roll i att säkerställa att våra tekniska lösningar skapar konkret affärsnytta och hållbar utveckling. Du arbetar metodiskt för att knyta affärsstrategier och mål till utveckling av vår arkitektur. I rollen arbetar du strategiskt, taktiskt och operativt med långsiktiga planer för målarkitekturen och lösningsdesign samt kvalitetssäkring av utvecklingsarbetet inklusive de processer och rutiner som krävs för att leverera stabil IT. I arbetet ingår även att omvärldsbevaka och prioritera utvecklingsinsatser för robusta och tillgängliga IT-lösningar.
   

  

 Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter inkluderar:
   

  

* Leda och fördela arbetet inom enheten
* Långsiktiga planer för IT genom arbete i IT-ledningsgruppen
* Bollplank till IT och verksamheten
* Stöd till arkitekter inom enheten
* Praktisk och helhetsorienterad arkitektur
* Kvalitetssäkring av arkitekturfrågor och skapandet av ramverk, policys och riktlinjer relaterat området
* Medverkar i projekt som styrgruppsmedlem eller referens för att säkerställa att rätt effekter kan inhämtas
* Tar fram, validerar, verifierar och kvalitetssäkrar tekniska lösningar
* Säkerställer att samverkan inom IT och med verksamheten sker på ett smidigt och affärsorienterat sätt


 Vem är du?
   

  

 Vi söker dig som har en stabil teknisk grund och tydlig förståelse för hur affärsstrategier och mål kan knytas till arkitekturens utveckling. Du har erfarenhet av att omsätta strategisk förståelse till taktiska planer och att identifiera samband mellan övergripande och detaljerade frågeställningar. Du är van vid att ta snabba beslut relaterat införande av system och utveckling av tekniska lösningar. Du har praktisk erfarenhet av att delta i införandet av större tekniska lösningar och att leda och coacha seniora IT-medarbetare. Du har också god kännedom om IT-säkerhet.
   

  

 Nödvändiga erfarenheter:
   

  

* Erfarenhet som chef eller innehaft ledande roller.
* Gedigen erfarenhet inom arkitektur, gärna som IT-arkitekt, lösningsarkitekt eller Enterprisearkitekt.
* Utbildning och erfarenhet inom systemutveckling, design, arkitektur och har kodkompetens.
* Erfarenhet av informationsmodellering och att omsätta verksamhetskrav till tekniska lösningar.
* Praktisk erfarenhet av att ta fram tekniska lösningar och ha en ledande roll i implementering.
* Förståelse för hur en IT-enhet behöver leverera för att säkerställa robust och kontinuerlig utveckling inkl. nätverk, lagring, övervakning och säkerhet i Azure.


 Meriterande:
   

  

* Kunskap om befintliga ramverk inom Enterprisearkitektur, infrastruktur & cloud, applikationsutveckling, integrationsutveckling, informationsmodellering, processkartläggning, Azure, Microsoft 365, och Power Platform.
* Erfarenhet av arbete inom IT-ledningsgrupp.
* Erfarenhet inom bygg- och anläggningsbranschen.


 En del av något större
   

  

 Denna roll kommer att rapportera till CIO och ingå i IT-ledningsgruppen på Svevia IT. Enhetens ansvarar för att skapa rätt förutsättningar för Svevia att fatta välgrundade beslut om teknik, IT-vägval och kunna uppnå strategiska mål. Detta görs genom att förbättra och tydliggöra tidsenlig & relevant målarkitektur.
   

  

 Vi är lyhörda för förändringar i verksamheterna och stödjer design och implementering av tekniska lösningar och arbetssätt som är i linje med affärens behov. Genom nära samarbete med både IT och verksamhet förstår vi behov och mål som kan omsättas i planer och målbilder. Vi säkerställer att vi gemensamt tar välgrundade, datadrivna beslut – från val av mjukvara till övergripande lösningsarkitektur, där teknik, processer och arbetssätt fungerar tillsammans.
   

  

 Varför Svevia?
   

  

 Utifrån Svevias strategier, mål och värdegrund får du de förutsättningar som krävs för att göra skillnad och bidra till företagets utveckling. Beslutsvägarna är korta, det är lätt att påverka och göra sin röst hörd. Och hos oss står ledarskapet i fokus, vilket gör att du kontinuerligt får möjlighet att utvecklas i din roll.
   

  

 Vi månar om att vara en arbetsplats för alla. Att du ska leda genom dina medarbetare ser vi som en självklarhet. Det är som lag vi skapar framgång. Det är så vi gör affärer och genererar resultat. Det är så vi får stad och land att fungera. Vill du dela väg med oss?
   

  

 Ansökan och information
   

  

*Du ansöker enkelt genom att skicka in ditt CV och svara på några urvalsfrågor. Vår rekryteringsprocess bygger på ett kompetensbaserat arbetssätt, det är en förutsättning för att rekrytera kvalitetssäkert, inkluderande och fördomsfritt. Därför vill vi inte ha ett personligt brev.*
*Skicka in din ansökan snarast möjligt och som senast den 3e augusti. Urval görs efter sista ansökningsdatum.*
*Har du frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta CIO Maria Wester på maria.wester@svevia.se. Har du frågor om rekryteringsprocessen kontaktar du HR-Specialist Ludvig Zetterman Dahlen på ludvig.zetterman-dahlen@svevia.se. Pga semestertider kommer svar att dröja.*
*Vi har tagit ställning till annonsering, vilket gör att vi inte önskar säljsamtal för ytterligare frågor kring annonsering, rekrytering eller bemanning.*

title: Manager Product Launch & Change to Coca-Cola Europacific Partners Sweden
description:
**About Us**
 Coca-Cola Europacific Partners (CCEP) is one of the leading consumer goods companies in the world with a dedicated team of 42 000 people, who work together with manufacture, distribution, sales and industry marketing of Coca-Cola in 31 countries. In Sweden, we are around 750 committed colleagues at our production site and head office (also called "Happiness Factory") in Haninge outside Stockholm. CCEP Sweden represents some of the beverage world's strongest brands such as Coca-Cola, Fanta, Sprite, Powerade and Monster, but also strong local brands such as bonaqua and Mer.
   

  

**Main responsibilities:**
* Lead and manage 20–25 product change and new product development projects in various stages.
* Drive product management deliverables including business cases, risk assessments and set key requirements and success criteria.
* Align stakeholders across Supply Chain to ensure success in productivity, safety, quality, delivery, and cost.
* Coordinate logistical data, specifications, artworks and masterdata creation.
* Ensure projects are delivered on time and in line with project management standards.
* Develop, align and execute detailed project plans covering scope, schedule, costs.
* Manage project communication with key stakeholders both internal and external.
* Act as the Supply Chain representative in collaboration with Marketing and Brand Managers.
* Build strong cross-functional relationships to drive project success.


**To be successful in this role you need:**
* University degree level in relevant field.
* Minimum of 3 years of experience in a project management role with a proven track record of delivering medium / large sized / technical projects.
* Strong interpersonal and influencing skills to interact effectively with colleagues, cross-functional teams, and external stakeholders.
* Proficiency in MS office, SAP and masterdata management.
* Working knowledge of the Supply Chain is an advantage.
* Excellent communication skills and fluency in English.
* Ability to manage both strategic and detailed tasks in a fast-paced and changing environment.
* Experience in the FMCG industry is a strong advantage.


**To be a successful project leader / Manager Product Launch & Change** 
 it is key to be structured, process-driven and have the ability to coordinate multiple projects running at the same time and in different stages. You are a proactive problem solver who positively influences those around you and builds strong, collaborative relationships.
   

  

**If this sounds like your kind of challenge, apply today!**
 Attach your CV and cover letter by using the application link. You can expect to hear from us regarding the first step in the recruitment process in the beginning of August. If you have any questions regarding the position, please contact eknutas@ccep.com. Please note that we do not accept applications through e-mail, due to GDPR.
   

  

**What We Offer**
 Coca-Cola Europacific Partners (CCEP) is a major fast-moving consumer goods business and the world’s largest independent Coca-Cola bottler. We usually say, “You may join the brand, but stay for the people”, and it really is! With us, you get the opportunity to grow in a fast and innovative industry, together with our employees, consumers and customers. You get a lot of own responsibility from day one and the opportunity to really make a difference. Our recipe for success is that we are passionate, hard-working and committed to our products, our customers and each other. CCEP is a place where people can grow, be happy and be well in a safe, open and inclusive workplace. We value a diverse workforce and welcome you to apply regardless of gender, age or ethnicity. If you are interested in the stories of the people behind our beverages, please visit https://www.coca-cola.se/100voices.

title: Chief Information Security Officer - Intelligent Manufacturing
description:
Do you thrive on turning complexity into clarity? Want to shape the future of cybersecurity in a global industrial tech environment? At Sandvik, we’re on a mission to secure the digital backbone of our Intelligent Manufacturing business – and we’re looking for someone ready to lead the charge.
   

  

**Your mission**
 This role combines strategic thinking, operational execution, and leadership, while engaging with customers who have high security requirements – as you guide, support, and elevate all our business units. You lead the development and execution of our cybersecurity and product security strategies, ensuring our software and information assets are secure and compliant with global regulations.
   

  

 You work closely with our leadership team, legal, and cybersecurity peers across Sandvik. Stakeholder management is key – this isn’t just about setting rules, it’s about building trust and helping others succeed. You also manage one direct report and play a critical role in shaping how we work with security across the business. This is a role where persistence pays off. Security isn’t always top of mind – until it is. Your challenge is to make it a priority before it becomes a problem!
   

  

 The location for this position is preferably Stockholm, with a hybrid setup that allows for flexibility. You report to the Head of IT of Intelligent Manufacturing and collaborate across time zones, meaning a bit of flexibility goes a long way!
   

  

**About You**
 You bring a strong foundation in cybersecurity and a genuine passion for the field. You’ve worked in larger organizations and know how to navigate complex stakeholder landscapes. You’re comfortable switching gears – from presenting to executive leadership to diving into technical discussions with security engineers. You have experience working closely with IT and development teams, and you speak their language fluently. Relevant certifications are a plus. Acting in a truly global environment calls for excellent English skills, verbally and in writing.
   

  

 You’re not just a policy enforcer – you’re a trusted advisor. Someone who listens, guides, and sometimes says no, but always with the bigger picture in mind. You understand that when people feel heard, they’re more likely to follow your lead. You’re resilient, pragmatic, and know how to keep momentum even when things move slowly.
   

  

**Our culture**
 At Sandvik, we’re tech driven, innovative and entrepreneurial. We believe that success is a team effort so we value diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive culture where people can be themselves and reach their full potential. So, we invest in supporting each other, learning together and celebrating our differences. Visit our stories hub, LinkedIn or Facebook to get to know us further.
   

  

**Contact information**
 For further information about this position, please contact Henrik Damberg, hiring manager, henrik.damberg@sandvik.com
   

  

 We’ve already decided on which advertising channels and marketing campaigns we wish to use and respectfully decline any additional contact in that matter.
   

  

 Union contacts – Sweden
   

  

* Thomas Lilja, Unionen, +46 (0)70 261 04 82
* Tord Engström, Akademikerföreningen, +46 (0)76 106 62 87
* Peter Olsson-Andrée, Ledarna, +46 (0)70 222 48 55


 Recruitment Specialist: Lotta Amnebjer Nordqvist
   

  

 At Sandvik, we value work-life balance and due to summer vacation, it may take a little bit longer until we reply in this process.
   

  

**How To Apply**
 Send your application no later than August 10th, 2025. Click apply and include your resume and cover letter in English. Please note that we don’t accept applications by e-mail. Job ID: R0080990.
   

  

 As we aim for a fair recruitment process, we utilize assessment tools to safeguard objectivity. When you apply for this job, you will therefore receive an invitation via email to a personality and logic ability test. Feedback comes immediately after the test has been completed and the selection process begins after the application deadline.
   

  

 To learn more about our recruitment process, please visit our career site or contact HR Services at hrservices.sweden@sandvik.com.
   

  

*Machining and Intelligent Manufacturing is a business area within the Sandvik Group and a global market-leading manufacturer of tools and tooling systems for advanced industrial metal cutting. The business area also comprises the areas of additive manufacturing and digital manufacturing solutions. In 2024, sales were approximately 48,5 billion SEK with about 20,800 employees.*

title: Customer Success Representative Netherlands
description:
Dedicated to powering entrepreneurs, Qred is a profitable, fast-growing fintech scale-up bank. In just 10 years, we’ve grown from a startup to hitting 1 billion SEK in annual revenue supporting over 50,000 entrepreneurs and helping create 10,000+ jobs every year. We combine smart tech with real-world experience to make funding simple, fast, and fair for entrepreneurs who need it most. With strong backing, a flat organization, and bold growth plans, we’re now looking for a Dutch-speaking Customer Success Representative to join us and shape the future of small business owners.
   

  

**About The Role**
 The role of Customer Success Representative involves supporting our Dutch customers via all of our inbound contact channels, phone, chat, and email. You will resolve our customer's errands which will be broad and varied, it can be anything from technical support or questions about an ongoing loan application. You will take full ownership of the customer's onboarding process and sales funnel. Solve errands and drive customer satisfaction through excellent customer service.
   

  

 In this role, you will collaborate with colleagues within the Customer Service/Sales team as well as other stakeholders and departments to drive errand resolution. We have grown the Dutch Customer Success team immensely in the past years and also received our banking license at the end of 2023. Therefore, you will also have an impact on new routines and ways of working both internally and on how we operate towards our customers. In this role, you will be a part of a large and diverse team of 19 people that houses Underwriters, Customer Success, and Collection Agents among others. This role reports directly to one of the two Team Leads.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Manage inbound customer errands, via phone, chat, and email
* Take full ownership of the resolution and the customer-facing contact
* Collaborate with colleagues both within and outside the team to drive improvements


**Qualifications**
* Experience in customer service, preferably via phone and email
* Basic knowledge of financial products
* Proven capabilities in high customer satisfaction
* Strong sense of ownership & detail orientation
* Curiosity and a will to constantly want to improve
* Fluency in Dutch, both written and spoken
* Proficient in English, as it's our primary business language
* Experience from previous fintech and/or fast-growing companies is a plus


**One last thing - if you’re about to send in your application**
 This is a full-time, permanent position based in Stockholm. Don’t wait to send in your application, we are reviewing applications on a rolling basis. While the start date is flexible, the right candidate can join us immediately.
   

  

*Qred celebrates diversity and does not discriminate based on ethnicity, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, disability status, or any other applicable characteristics protected by law.*
 Qred is an international FinTech scale-up that specializes in digital financing solutions for small businesses, with operations in the Nordics, Benelux, Germany and Brazil. We are passionate about helping small businesses thrive and grow, by providing them with business loans and credit cards. Right now we’re in an exciting phase of our journey that focuses on growth through smart product development and technology fueled by international expansion.

title: (Associate) Unified Communication Systems Engineer – based in Luxembourg
description:
**This position is based at our Luxembourg headquarters and requires regular office presence.** 
 The EIB offers you the opportunity to live and work in a truly international and multi-cultural environment. We also offer relocation support. The
 **EIB** 
 , the European Union's bank, is seeking to recruit for its Information Systems Directorate (IS), Platforms & Services Department (P&S), Infrastructure Services Division (IS), UC & Windows Client Services Unit (UCWS) at its headquarters in Luxembourg, a
 **(Associate) Unified Communications Systems Engineer\***
**This is a full-time temporary position at grade 4/5.**
* internal benchmark (Associate) Engineer IT Technology & Infrastructure


**The term of this contract will be 3 years**
 The existence of this position is linked to the CAPEX Programme which is foreseen for 3 years. The Bank may terminate any employment contract in case the CAPEX Programme ceases to exist.
   

  

*Panel interviews are foreseen as from September 2025*
 Purpose
   

  

 The EIB is currently going through a significant capital investment project for our new building. In this role, you will work on the technology roadmap, focusing on designing and delivering unified communication systems.
   

  

 Your work will directly contribute to providing our staff with secure and top-tier unified communication technology services with a particular focus on meeting and board rooms. You will be responsible for coordinating technology and services across various projects, playing a crucial role in our operations.
   

  

 This is a unique opportunity to contribute to the EIB Group’s growth and development.
   

  

 Operating Network
   

  

 You will report to the Head of Unified Communications & Windows Client Unit and will collaborate with colleagues across the EIB Group, particularly with the New Building Unit and IT. In addition, you will collaborate with external consultants as well as suppliers.
   

  

 Accountabilities
   

  

* Configure, deploy and monitor unified communication systems, ensuring alignment with organizational and security requirements as well as industry best practices
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams and coordinate tasks and activities with team members
* Identify and report potential issues and contribute to their resolution as well as drive system upgrades and patch management activities under the guidance of senior team members
* Assist in capacity monitoring activities, assessing the scalability needs for unified communication systems
* Gather and report user feedback on unified communication tools, keeping in mind the continuous improvement of user experiences.
* Draft accurate and up-to-date documentation for unified communication configurations, processes, and troubleshoot procedures whilst adhering to compliance requirements


**Qualifications**
* University degree (minimum an equivalent to a Bachelor) preferably in Computer Science or related disciplines.
* Minimum 3 years of relevant professional experience, including in IT infrastructure and unified communication systems with specific knowledge of Microsoft Teams and Cisco Webex
* Hands-on experience in implementing and integrating unified communication systems.
* Additional understanding of security principles in the context of unified communication systems is an advantage
* Excellent knowledge of English and/or French (\*\*\*), with a good command of the other. Knowledge of other EU languages would be an advantage


 Competencies
   

  

*Find out more about EIB core competencies* 
 here
   

  

 To find out more about our eligibility criteria click here
   

  

*(\*\*\*) Unless stated explicitly as a required qualification, a good command of French is not a pre-requisite for hire. As both English and French are however official working languages of the EIB, proficiency in both languages is a pre-requisite for your future career development. Any language clause in your contract must be fulfilled in order for you to be eligible for a promotion (either via the annual appraisal cycle or via an internal selection process). Proficiency is understood to mean the attainment of* 
*level 5 of the Inter Institutional language courses, corresponding to B1.2 of the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages (CEFRL). The Bank offers appropriate training support.*
 We hire and value talent with unique characteristics, creating a work environment where they can be themselves. We believe that Diversity, Equity and Inclusion makes us a performing and innovative organisation. We encourage all suitably qualified and eligible candidates to apply regardless of their gender identity/expression, age, racial, ethnic and cultural background, religion and beliefs, sexual orientation, disability or neurodiversity.
   

  

 We strongly invite applicants with a disability, neurodivergent profile or chronic condition to request reasonable accommodations at any stage during the recruitment process. Please contact the EIB Recruitment team Jobs@eib.org who will ensure that your request is handled.
   

  

 By applying for this position, you acknowledge the importance of maintaining the security and integrity of the Information of the EIB Group. In case of selection for the position you agree to comply with all measures (policies, controls, document classification and management) implemented by the EIB Group to prevent unauthorised disclosure of any information or any damage to the EIB Group reputation.
   

  

*This is an open campaign to consecutively fill open positions. The campaign will remain open until the position is filled. Applications will be reviewed in order of receipt.*

title: Vice President Research & Development
description:
Do you thrive on turning cutting-edge research into real-world impact? At Sandvik Coromant, we’re looking for a visionary leader to take on a position that’s more than managing projects – it’s about shaping culture, building talent, and ensuring our R&D capabilities outperform the competition.
   

  

**Some Words About Us**
 We don’t just develop tools – we shape the future of machining. Our R&D team is at the heart of this mission, driving innovation that fuels sustainable and profitable growth. We work closely with pioneering customers, technology-leading institutes, and global partners to stay ahead of the curve. This is a team that’s bold, collaborative, and deeply committed to delivering value – fast.
   

  

**Your mission**
 As Vice President R&D, you lead the development and execution of our global research and technology strategy. You’re part of the Sandvik Coromant Management team, setting direction and driving cross-functional collaboration to deliver world-class solutions. Taking ownership of the full product portfolio, you ensure that our R&D efforts align with commercial ambitions, customer needs, and sustainability goals.
   

  

 You develop the best people and organisations.
   

  

 You build and empower a high-performing organization that:
   

  

* Delivers R&D projects that create customer value – efficiently and swiftly
* Drives digitalization and innovation through internal and external partnerships
* Embeds sustainability and cost-efficiency into every product range
* Champions knowledge-sharing, agile ways of working, and continuous improvement


 This position offers flexible working arrangements, preferably Europe, and you report directly to the President of Sandvik Coromant.
   

  

**Your profile**
 We’re looking for someone with a master’s degree in science or a related field, you’ve led product development and technology organizations with a strong strategic lens. You combine deep technical understanding with solid business acumen and a customer-first mindset. Experience in general management and cross-functional leadership is key. Acting in a truly global environment calls for proficiency in English, verbally and in writing.
   

  

 You lead with integrity, curiosity, and courage. You’re entrepreneurial, decisive, and comfortable navigating complexity. With a humble and trusting approach, you build trust, challenge the status quo, and inspire teams to grow and deliver. You think holistically, act collaboratively, and never lose sight of the bigger picture. A flexible schedule and global mindset are essential.
   

  

**Our culture**
 Innovation is in our DNA and we’re proud to shape the future of manufacturing in close collaboration with our customers and partners. We believe in an inclusive, equal and open-minded culture, and we nurture our diversities to form a solid foundation for achieving great results. Add fair and rewarding benefits, as well as many different career opportunities in an inspiring global environment. Meet some of your future colleagues at our career page or visit our website, LinkedIn or Facebook page to get to know us further.
   

  

**Contact information** 
  

  

 For further information about this position, please contact:
   

  

 Gabriella Huss, Executive Talent Acquisition Expert, gabriella.huss@sandvik.com
   

  

 We’ve already decided on what advertising channels and marketing campaigns we wish to use and respectfully decline any additional contacts.
   

  

**Hiring Manager** 
  

  

 Helen Blomqvist, President Sandvik Coromant
   

  

**How To Apply**
 Please send us your application through our application system as soon as possible and no later than August 31, 2025. Job ID: R0081560. Please note that we don’t accept applications by e-mail.
   

  

 Our recruitment process is open and fair – we welcome all applicants and evaluate every unique application in line with the specified requirements profile, to find the best match for the position. To learn more about our recruitment process, please visit our career site or contact HR Services at
   

  

 hrservices.sweden@sandvik.com.
   

  

*Sandvik Coromant is part of the global industrial engineering group Sandvik and is at the forefront of developing manufacturing tools and machining solutions, with knowledge that drives the industry standards and innovations demanded by the metalworking industry now and in the next industrial era. Collaborations with educational institutions, extensive investment in research and development and strong customer partnership ensure the development of machining technologies that change, lead and drive the future of manufacturing. Sandvik Coromant owns over 1700 patents worldwide, employs around 8000 staff and is represented in more than 150 countries.*

title: Systemutvecklare .NET
description:
**Att jobba som systemutvecklare .NET**
 Som systemutvecklare .NET på Skandia får du vara med och utveckla några av våra mest affärskritiska och samhällsnyttiga system, våra bolånesystem och produkter mot privatkunder. Du kommer att tillhöra ett team inom vårt område låna där fokus är på att förbättra våra värdeflöden mot slutkund.
   

  

 Vi arbetar med både nyutveckling och vidareutveckling av våra befintliga system. Du kommer få arbeta genom hela utvecklingskedjan från kravanalys och design till implementation, testautomatisering och innovation.
   

  

 Du blir en del av ett engagerat team som sitter i på vårt huvudkontor i Stockholm. Teamet består idag av PO, mjukvaruarkitekt, systemutvecklare och produktspecialist. Vi tror på att dela med oss av kunskap, labba och experimentera i vardagen till exempel genom mobprogrammering. Det är viktigt för oss att du som ny kollega snabbt känner dig som en naturlig del av teamet. Vi jobbar med avancerad affärslogik och ett systemlandskap med hög grad av integrationer vilket ger en utmanande och stimulerande vardag. Genom att arbeta aktivt med DevOps och hela tiden förbättra våra verktyg och arbetsflöden för att testa och leverera kod, kan vi utveckla i högt tempo utan att tumma på kvaliteten.
   

  

**Teamet Sitter Med Följande Techstack Idag**
* NET 8/9


 SQL Server
   

  

 Git & REST-API:er
   

  

 Azure DevOps & Octopus Deploy
   

  

 Splunk, NServiceBus & AppDynamics
   

  

 Vi arbetar hybrid vilket innebär arbete på kontoret varvat med distansarbete. I rollen kommer du att rapportera till närmaste gruppchef för IT Låna.
   

  

**För att lyckas i rollen**
 Som person är du målmedveten och tar gärna egna initiativ för förbättringar samtidigt som du att samarbeta i teamet. Du är nyfiken och har en vilja att lära dig både nya domäner och tekniker. I jobbet är du ordningsam och arbetar strukturerat även när tempot är högt. Eftersom vi formar ett nytt team ser du förändring som ett naturligt tillfälle att testa nya idéer och arbetssätt.
   

  

 Du har några års erfarenhet av systemutveckling inom .NET/C#. Du har arbetat med SQL server och kan hantera databehandling, till exempel händelse- och meddelandehantering eller schemalagda körningar.
   

  

 Ett grundkrav är att du har en god kommunikativ förmåga både i tal och skrift på svenska och engelska.
   

  

 Meriterande för rollen är om du har arbetat med verktyg som Azure DevOps, Octopus Deploy, Splunk, NServiceBus och AppDynamics.
   

  

 Vi har dessutom påbörjat vår resa med GitHub Copilot och ser det som en självklarhet att du vill ligga i framkant inom AI-stödd systemutveckling.
   

  

**Vad händer nu?**
 Vi jobbar med löpande urval så tveka inte att skicka in din ansökan redan idag. I ansökan kommer vi att ställa ett antal urvalsfrågor som ligger till grund för första urvalet. För att göra rekryteringsprocessen så rättvis och objektiv som möjligt kommer det att ingå intervjuer, tester, bakgrundskontroll samt digital referenstagning.
   

  

 Om du har frågor kring rollen vänligen ta kontakt med rekryterande chef Stefan Ravelius på stefan.ravelius@skandia.se.
   

  

 Om du har frågor kopplat till rekryteringsprocessen ta kontakt med Talent Acquisition Partner Harald Brehmer på harald.brehmer@skandia.se.
   

  

 Vi kommer att återkoppla till alla som söker oavsett om du går vidare eller inte.
   

  

*Psst.. i och med att det är semestertider kan rekryteringsprocessen dra ut på tiden. Vi kommer återkoppla till dig som senast i mitten av augusti.*
 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

**Mer om IT**
 Vi på Skandia IT är stolta över att vara en kundorienterad enhet som levererar effektiva och säkra lösningar för våra kunder. Med cirka 600 engagerade medarbetare är vi mitt i en spännande transformationsresa, där vi utvecklas tillsammans och har kul på vägen. Framåt tillsammans är vårt motto!
   

  

 Vi arbetar agilt och har sedan 2017 använt oss av SAFe (Scaled Agile Framework) ramverket, där leverans och kundvärde alltid står i centrum. Våra tågledningar och team, jobbar verksamhetsbaserat med aktiviteter som sprintplanering, daily stand-ups, team-synk, code reviews och retrospektiv.
   

  

 Var 12:e vecka samlas vi alla i vår ljusa och inspirerande Ljusgård på kontoret i Stockholm för 2 planeringsdagar. Planeringsperioden består av 6 tvåveckorssprintar, där den sista sprinten är en innovationssprint. Här får du chansen att, själv eller tillsammans med ditt team, utveckla och förfina våra system.

title: Azure Infrastructure Specialist
company_industry: Paper and Forest Product Manufacturing and Packaging and Containers Manufacturing
description:
**Job Description**
 At Billerud we believe that when we have tomorrow in mind, we will do our very best today. It is thanks to our employees that we are a world-leading company within the field of renewable paper and packaging materials. Do you want to realize your true value and work for a sustainable tomorrow? Join us!
   

  

**We are now looking for an experienced Azure Infrastructure Specialist with experience in building and operating Azure infrastructure platform**
 Billerud's IT organization is expanding and in this new role, you will have the main responsibility for building and operating the infrastructure on a globally available, high-performance and secure Azure platform. You'll use your expertise to manage GitOps/DevOps, networks and resources and PaaS environments. Your role involves collaborating with the security team to manage Azure security and building and driving monitoring and visibility for both platform and applications.
   

  

**In This Role, You Are Responsible For**
* Build and run repos and pipelines for GitOps/DevOps
* Build and run networks and resources
* Management of PaaS environments
* Management of Azure platform through GitOps/DevOps
* Management of Azure security together with Security Team
* Build and run monitoring and observability (both platform and application)
* Support and coach Internal Staff learning above areas


 You will report to the Manager of IT Network & Security and be based onsite at one of our Swedish units: Gävle, Skärblacka, Frövi, Gruvön, Karlsborg (Kalix) or at our head office in Solna, Stockholm.
   

  

**Overtime, on-call duty and travel in service within Sweden and potentially to north America may occur occasionally.**
 At Billerud, we put Safety First. Together we take great pride in our responsibility to contribute to a safe work environment. Please read more about our Safety First initiative
   

  

**Qualifications**
 To succeed in the role of
 **Azure Specialist** 
 , we believe you have relevant academic education, or equivalent experience and preferably good experience in building and drive an Azure platform. In summary we see that you have solid experience in all, or most, of the below areas:
   

  

* Azure platform, network & polices management
* Azure DevOps for GitOps Management & PaaS services management
* Infrastructure as code with Bicep
* Secure development lifecycle experience
* Knowledge in Powershell scripting
* We support Billerud globally and fluency in both English and Swedish is important.


**Workplace & conditions**
* This is an onsite position at one of our Swedish locations. Hybrid work is possible in line with our company policy (up to 2 remote days per week or depending on project needs).
* Please note: We do not offer relocation packages and applicants requires a valid Swedish work permit


**Personal qualities**
 We value your personality highly. To thrive in this role, you should have strong analytical and problem-solving skills, along with a curiosity for both new and familiar challenges. You enjoy working independently as well as in teams, and you communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical colleagues. Since we support Billerud globally, fluency in both English and Swedish is important. You stay up to date with new technologies and industry trends, and you actively contribute to a positive work environment.
   

  

 Our values are very important for us and we believe that you recognize yourself in: We care for each other and We do what we say.
   

  

**Contact**
 If you want to know more about the position, you are welcome to contact Åke Olsson, Senior Manager Global IT Network & Security at ake.olsson@billerud.com. If you want to know more about the recruitment process, you are welcome to contact Julia Åkerlund, Talent Acquisition Partner, at julia.akerlund@billerud.com.
   

  

**Due to the holiday season, feedback and communication may take longer than usual during the summer period. We appreciate your patience and understanding.**
 We decline proposals from external recruitment providers.
   

  

**Application information**
**Please submit your application by August 10th. Selection will occur after final application date.**
 Billerud is an equal opportunity employer. We embrace diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees and candidates.
   

  

**Why us?**
* Join both a local and a global team of skilled professionals!
* An opportunity to contribute to a more sustainable future
* Development and career opportunities
* Performance-based bonus, occupational pension and a number of different benefits according to company policy.
* Opportunity to hybrid working according to company standard.


**Our recruitment process** 
 will include interviews, recruitment test and reference checks. Final candidate will require a negative alcohol- & drug test as well as background checks.
   

  

**Do you want to help create a sustainable future through your work?**
 At Billerud, we are fully committed to reduce our and our customers carbon footprint by offering high-performance paper and packaging materials. We are convinced that the right solutions can be important tools to help fight climate change. That's why we see it as our responsibility to enable the best packaging choices, for a better tomorrow.
   

  

 Our proud history in the forestry and paper industry goes back more than 150 years. Since then, we’ve grown to what we are today: a world leading company in high-performing paper and packaging materials - passionately committed to sustainability, quality, and customer value. Our materials are the basis of packaging and paper products used by millions of people around the world, 24 hours a day, all year round.
   

  

 We serve customers in more than 100 countries through our three business areas Liquid Packaging Board, Paper and Paper Board. Our nine production units are located in Sweden, USA, and Finland and we have around 6,000 employees in 19 countries. Our annual turnover is approximately SEK 43.5 billion and the share is listed on Nasdaq Stockholm. At Billerud we always put safety first, care for each other, and do what we say.
   

  

**Join us in redefining sustainable packaging and drive meaningful change for a better tomorrow.**

title: Supporttekniker
description:
Har du arbetat något/några år i en servicedesk, som onsite-tekniker eller IT-tekniker ? Vi på Nexer Infrastructure i Stockholm söker nu fler konsulter som är sugna på att fördjupa sina kunskaper samt utvecklas inom IT. Hos oss får chansen att arbeta hos välkända bolag i Stockholmsområdet.
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig**
* Trygga anställningsvillkor och en fast månadslön
* Goda utvecklingsmöjligheter som konsult och en långsiktig plan hos Nexer
* En familjär atmosfär och teambuildingaktiviteter med dina Nexer-kollegor – senast var vi på en Åreresa tillsammans!


**Om tjänsten**
 Som konsult inom IT-support arbetar du brett inom IT och användarstöd, och mer specifikt mot ramverk och verktyg så som Active Directory, Windows OS, Microsoft 365, grundläggande nätverksteknologier och ärendehanteringssystem såsom ServiceNow med flera. De flesta uppdragen innebär att du hjälper någon av våra kunder med IT-support på klientsidan och supporterar internt anställda genom telefon, mail, chatt och ärendehanteringssystem. I vissa uppdrag kan även onsite-support förekomma samt hårdvarusupport för datorer, kringutrustning, skrivare och AV utrustning.
   

  

**Vi ser gärna att du**
* Har tidigare erfarenhet av arbete i servicedesk/first line support
* Motiveras av att lösa problem och lämna användaren med ett leende på läpparna
* Trivs i att bemöta människor och ge stöttning på ett pedagogiskt sätt
* Har obehindrade kunskaper i svenska i både tal och skrift


 Vi ser gärna att du är bekant med följande tekniker: Active Directory, Windows OS, Microsoft 365/Azure, Windows Remote Desktop, SCCM/Intune, arbete i ärendehanteringssystem samt grundläggande kunskap inom felsökning av nätverk. Det är också ett plus om du har supporterat Mac klienter tidigare.
   

  

 För att trivas i rollen som konsult hos oss tror vi att du har god analytisk förmåga, tar initiativ och är ihärdig när det gäller felsökning och problemlösning. Vi tror även att du har god samarbetsförmåga och trivs med att arbeta både individuellt och i grupp, eftersom du som konsult kan komma att arbeta i olika sammanhang.
   

  

**Mer o** 
**m Nexer Infrastructure**
 Nexer Infrastructure (vi hette då Sigma IT Tech) startade sin verksamhet 2018 och är specialister på en sak – talanger inom drift, support och IT-infrastruktur. Vi hjälper företag att växa och framtids säkra sin kompetens med hjälp av flexibla konsulttjänster. Bland våra kunder finns många välkända aktörer som är marknadsledande inom sina respektive branscher.
   

  

 Som IT- konsult hos oss blir du väl omhändertagen och vi är måna om att du ska trivas. Vi lägger stor vikt vid att upprätthålla den goda stämningen i vår grupp, bland annat genom gemensamma aktiviteter som föreläsningar, after works och gemensamma lunch träffar. Blir du konsult hos oss lyssnar vi till dig, dina behov och i vilken riktning du vill utvecklas.
   

  

  

  

**Ansökan** 
  

  

 Då urval sker löpande ser vi gärna att du skickar in din ansökan så snart som möjligt. Vi ser fram emot att läsa den!

title: Engineering Manager - App Stores
description:
Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation, and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1200+ colleagues in 75+ countries and very few office-based roles. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.
   

  

 The company is founder-led, profitable, and growing.
   

  

 This is a technical management role to lead a team that develops Python and Golang micro-services that power our global software distribution engine. The world sees it as the Snap Store and Charmhub.io marketplaces, behind the scenes it is a unified system that understands key concepts in software distribution - architectures, releases, betas, release candidates, stable releases, branches and more. We are on a journey to transform the experience that people all over the world have with their open source software by significantly expanding the range of software we can deliver through this system. If you have a passion for clean APIs, believe that great engineers ship software calmly and regularly against an agile plan, and know that tests are the key to higher velocity and reliability, you'll fit right in.
   

  

 This is a great opportunity to take part in engineering a highly scalable SaaS product (think about the load on our systems when one of our largest Ubuntu Desktop snaps is updated by the publisher, for instance). In addition, you will have the opportunity to learn from Canonical's world-class security team as we work collectively to deliver this capability, safely, to our customers around the world.
   

  

 As an Engineering Manager at Canonical, you must be technically strong, but your main responsibility is to run an effective team and develop the colleagues you manage. You will develop and review code as a leader, but know that the best way to improve the product is to ensure that the whole team is focused, productive and unblocked. You are expected to help them grow as engineers, do meaningful work, do it outstandingly well, find professional and personal satisfaction, and work well with colleagues and the community. You will also be expected to be a positive influence on culture, facilitate technical delivery, and regularly reflect with your team on strategy and execution. You will collaborate closely with other Engineering Managers, product managers, and architects, producing an engineering roadmap with ambitious and achievable goals.
   

  

 We expect Engineering Managers to be fluent in the programming language, architecture, and components that their team uses. Code reviews and architectural leadership are part of the job. The commitment to healthy engineering practices, documentation, quality and performance optimisation is as important, as is the requirement for fair and clear management, and the obligation to ensure a high-performing team.
   

  

 This is a great opportunity to really learn how to do engineering of a highly-scalable SaaS product (think about the load on our systems when one of our largest Ubuntu Desktop snaps is updated by the publisher, for instance). In addition, you will have the opportunity to learn from Canonical's world-class security team as we work collectively to deliver this capability, safely, to our customers around the world.
   

  

**Location** 
 : This role may be based remotely in the Americas, Europe, Middle East or Africa time zones.
   

  

 What your day will look like
   

  

* Lead a remote team of engineers in your time zone
* Develop talent through coaching, mentoring, feedback, and hands-on career development
* Set and manage expectations with other engineering teams, management, and external stakeholders
* Be an active part of the leadership team and collaborate with other leaders in the organisation
* With your team, build clean web service APIs to support both CLI and web frontend clients, using Python (and optionally Golang).
* Engage with many other teams at Canonical, as well as the open-source community and commercial partners


 What we are looking for in you
   

  

* Good experience in leading modern, agile software development practices
* Experience in forming a healthy, collaborative engineering culture in line with the company values
* Demonstrative experience of being a role model for sound engineering principles and directly contributing toward your team's goals
* Willingness to travel up to 4 times a year for internal events
* You love to mentor, develop and grow people, and have a track record of doing it
* You are knowledgeable and passionate about software development
* You are focused on success and the timely delivery of high-quality software
* You value and nurture great team culture and spirit
* You have experience and commitment to agile development methodologies
* Software development experience in Python (experience in Golang in addition to that would be a big plus)
* Effective written and verbal communication skills
* Practical experience with Linux system administration


 What we offer you
   

  

 Your base pay will depend on various factors including your geographical location, level of experience, knowledge and skills. In addition to the benefits above, certain roles are also eligible for additional benefits and rewards including annual bonuses and sales incentives based on revenue or utilisation. Our compensation philosophy is to ensure equity right across our global workforce.
   

  

 In addition to a competitive base pay, we provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. Please note that additional benefits may apply depending on the work location and, for more information on these, you can ask in the later stages of the recruitment process.
   

  

* Fully remote working environment - we've been working remotely since 2004!
* Personal learning and development budget of 2,000USD per annum
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Parental leave
* Employee Assistance Programme
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues at 'sprints'
* Priority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open-source projects and the platform for AI, IoT, and the cloud, we are changing the world of software. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence; in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Most colleagues at Canonical have worked from home since our inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.
   

  

 Canonical is an equal opportunity employer
   

  

 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: Vice President Research & Development
description:
Do you thrive on turning cutting-edge research into real-world impact? At Sandvik Coromant, we’re looking for a visionary leader to take on a position that’s more than managing projects – it’s about shaping culture, building talent, and ensuring our R&D capabilities outperform the competition.
   

  

**Some Words About Us**
 We don’t just develop tools – we shape the future of machining. Our R&D team is at the heart of this mission, driving innovation that fuels sustainable and profitable growth.
