We work closely with pioneering customers, technology-leading institutes, and global partners to stay ahead of the curve. This is a team that’s bold, collaborative, and deeply committed to delivering value – fast.
   

  

**Your mission**
 As Vice President R&D, you lead the development and execution of our global research and technology strategy. You’re part of the Sandvik Coromant Management team, setting direction and driving cross-functional collaboration to deliver world-class solutions. Taking ownership of the full product portfolio, you ensure that our R&D efforts align with commercial ambitions, customer needs, and sustainability goals.
   

  

 You develop the best people and organisations.
   

  

 You build and empower a high-performing organization that:
   

  

* Delivers R&D projects that create customer value – efficiently and swiftly
* Drives digitalization and innovation through internal and external partnerships
* Embeds sustainability and cost-efficiency into every product range
* Champions knowledge-sharing, agile ways of working, and continuous improvement


 This position offers flexible working arrangements, preferably Europe, and you report directly to the President of Sandvik Coromant.
   

  

**Your profile**
 We’re looking for someone with a master’s degree in science or a related field, you’ve led product development and technology organizations with a strong strategic lens. You combine deep technical understanding with solid business acumen and a customer-first mindset. Experience in general management and cross-functional leadership is key. Acting in a truly global environment calls for proficiency in English, verbally and in writing.
   

  

 You lead with integrity, curiosity, and courage. You’re entrepreneurial, decisive, and comfortable navigating complexity. With a humble and trusting approach, you build trust, challenge the status quo, and inspire teams to grow and deliver. You think holistically, act collaboratively, and never lose sight of the bigger picture. A flexible schedule and global mindset are essential.
   

  

**Our culture**
 Innovation is in our DNA and we’re proud to shape the future of manufacturing in close collaboration with our customers and partners. We believe in an inclusive, equal and open-minded culture, and we nurture our diversities to form a solid foundation for achieving great results. Add fair and rewarding benefits, as well as many different career opportunities in an inspiring global environment. Meet some of your future colleagues at our career page or visit our website, LinkedIn or Facebook page to get to know us further.
   

  

**Contact information** 
  

  

 For further information about this position, please contact:
   

  

 Gabriella Huss, Executive Talent Acquisition Expert, gabriella.huss@sandvik.com
   

  

 We’ve already decided on what advertising channels and marketing campaigns we wish to use and respectfully decline any additional contacts.
   

  

**Hiring Manager** 
  

  

 Helen Blomqvist, President Sandvik Coromant
   

  

**How To Apply**
 Please send us your application through our application system as soon as possible and no later than August 31, 2025. Job ID: R0081560. Please note that we don’t accept applications by e-mail.
   

  

 Our recruitment process is open and fair – we welcome all applicants and evaluate every unique application in line with the specified requirements profile, to find the best match for the position. To learn more about our recruitment process, please visit our career site or contact HR Services at
   

  

 hrservices.sweden@sandvik.com.
   

  

*Sandvik Coromant is part of the global industrial engineering group Sandvik and is at the forefront of developing manufacturing tools and machining solutions, with knowledge that drives the industry standards and innovations demanded by the metalworking industry now and in the next industrial era. Collaborations with educational institutions, extensive investment in research and development and strong customer partnership ensure the development of machining technologies that change, lead and drive the future of manufacturing. Sandvik Coromant owns over 1700 patents worldwide, employs around 8000 staff and is represented in more than 150 countries.*

title: Data Engineer
company_industry: Architecture and Planning, Construction, and Civil Engineering
description:
**Introduktion**
 WSP Digital Solutions fortsätter att växa, och vi söker nu fler engagerade kollegor till vårt team inom Data Engineering & Analytics. Hos oss får du ett utvecklande, lärorikt och utmanande, men troligen fantastiskt roligt och givande jobb för dig som trivs i ett socialt sammanhang och med kollegor som brinner för teknik, precis som du! Du kommer till en avdelning som har hög trivsel och där vi alltid hjälps åt och är måna om varandra.
   

  

 På vår avdelning arbetar specialister inom bland annat projektledning, rådgivning, BIM, GIS, FME och data engineering. Tillsammans driver vi digitaliseringen av samhällsbyggnadsbranschen framåt.
   

  

**Ansvarsområde**
 Som Data Engineer hos oss blir du en del av ett kompetent team med fokus på att skapa digitala lösningar som gör verklig skillnad – främst inom transport- och infrastrukturprojekt. Du kommer att arbeta med utveckling i Microsofts plattform, med särskilt fokus på Azure, datalager och analys.
   

  

 Vi söker dig som har ett strukturerat arbetssätt, ett starkt intresse för innovation och effektivisering, samt en vilja att arbeta nära våra kunder i rollen som konsult. Eftersom vi profilerar oss med att ha kunskap både inom utveckling och samhällsbyggnadsbranschen ser vi gärna att du även har kunskap inom de båda områdena.
   

  

 Som person trivs du med att arbeta strukturerat och med fokus på innovation och effektivisering av interna processer. Vi ser att du har ett stort intresse för affärsutveckling och för att aktivt arbeta nära våra kunder som konsult.
   

  

**Vem söker vi?**
**Vi Söker Dig Som Har**
* Högskoleexamen inom geografisk IT, samhällsbyggnad, civilingenjör, transport, geoinformatik eller liknande.
* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av arbete inom data och analys, exempelvis dataintegrationer, datalager, ETL/ELT-flöden eller analysplattformar.
* Erfarenhet av design och arkitektur inom data & analys, inklusive datamodellering och lösningsdesign.
* Gedigen erfarenhet av Microsofts lösningar, såsom SQL Server, Azure, Power BI, SSAS m.fl.


 uppdrag där konsult har arbetat i organisation som hanterar/ planerar Trafik av något slag, tex inom, Buss, taxi, båt, flyg, tåg eller liknande.
   

  

**Kvalifikationer**
 För att lyckas i rollen behöver du ha arbetat några år inom området på konsultbasis inom samhällsbyggnad. Troligen arbetar du idag i en liknande befattning och är redo för en ny utmaning.
   

  

**Obligatoriska**
* Minst 5 års erfarenhet inom data engineering och/eller analytics.
* Högskoleutbildning inom GIS, samhällsbyggnad, byggteknik eller motsvarande.
* Erfarenhet av programmering i Python.
* Goda kunskaper i SQL och SQL Server.
* Erfarenhet av ETL-utveckling och datamodellering.
* Flytande svenska och engelska i tal och skrift.
* Svenskt medborgarskap


**Meriterande**
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta i Azure-miljö.
* Erfarenhet av att utveckla BI-lösningar.
* Kunskap om Python-bibliotek som pandas, numpy, requests och scikit-learn.
* Erfarenhet av integrationsverktyg som dbt och FME.
* Erfarenhet av maskininlärning och AI.


**Kontakt**
 Rekryterande chef: Linnea Mäepea Nilsson, linnea.nilsson@wsp.com
   

  

 HR-Rekrytering: Therese Galvez, therese.galvez@wsp.com
   

  

**Sista ansökningsdag**
 Urval sker löpande men vi vill senast få in din ansökan 2025-09-01
   

  

**OBS: Vi kikar på din ansökan så snart vi får möjlighet, men pga sommarsemester kan återkopplingen dröja**
 Kontakt från rekryteringsföretag, CV- och annonssäljare undanbedes.
   

  

**OM WSP I SVERIGE**
 WSP är en av världens ledande teknikkonsulter. Med en enastående bredd av ingenjörer, rådgivare och forskare förenas våra globala talanger för att utveckla lokala lösningar.
   

  

 WSP är verksamma i över 50 länder och har cirka 73 000 medarbetare, eller som vi säger Visionärer. På WSP i Sverige jobbar cirka 3 800 konsulter med att leverera innovativa projekt inom transport, infrastruktur, byggnation, miljö, projektledning, strategisk rådgivning och energi.
   

  

 Följ oss gärna på WSP Sverige (LinkedIn), WSP Sverige (Facebook), eller @wspsweden (Instagram) för en närmare inblick i vår verksamhet samt hur en dag i arbetet kan se ut för våra medarbetare.

title: Program Coordinator for SciLifeLab
description:
The task of Support services is to support the university's education and research. KTH's Support services are currently in an exciting phase where we are developing our working methods together. As an employee within Support services, you will contribute to KTH's mission to research, educate and create societal benefits, and at the same time, will get the opportunity for your own professional development.
   

  

**About SciLifeLab** 
 (Science for Life Laboratory) is Sweden's national research centre for molecular biosciences. We have a mission from the government and the centre is run on a non-profit basis as a collaboration between the founding universities KTH, KI, SU and UU and with operations at most other universities in Sweden. The collaboration across university boundaries creates synergies that drive research forward and the high-tech methods enable research that would otherwise not be possible in Sweden. At SciLifeLab, we do not only apply the latest and most advanced technology, we also develop novel technologies and transform the data they generate into knowledge.
   

  

**About The Department/group**
 In this role, you belong to the department that works with management and operational support for SciLifeLab's national mission, Operations Office. We are a total of 35 employees who are employed at either KTH or Uppsala University, of which 20 work in our department at SciLifeLab (KTH). The team is characterized by forward-thinking, strong commitment, and warm collegiality. Everyone is given space to take significant responsibility and grow through challenges, while always having support when needed.
   

  

 The role may evolve with the development of SciLifeLab as a national resource, meaning tasks could change or be added over time. Occasionally, responsibilities outside the scope of the role may also arise due to highly interactive and collaborative team spirit.
   

  

 You will be employed by KTH and your workplace will be at SciLifeLab in Solna.
   

  

**About Alpha Cell**
 The Alpha Cell initiative is a new flagship research program aiming to to map the molecular structure and function of single human cells in time and space and create AI-based models to predict human cells. It is funded by the Knut & Alice Wallenberg Foundation (KAW) and coordinated by SciLifeLab, with launch planned for 2026. The program involves cross-disciplinary research and collaboration with national and international partners. It is coordinated through SciLifeLab and led by Scientific Directors Professor Jan Ellenberg and Professor Mathias Uhlén. We are now seeking a dedicated and service-minded Program Coordinator to help drive the success of this newly created programme.
   

  

**Job Description**
 As Program Coordinator, you will be a central administrative resource working closely with the Scientific Program Manager, the Financial Manager, and the Scientific Directors. The role combines independent responsibility with recurring operational tasks, and you will have frequent interactions with stakeholders both within and outside the organisation.
   

  

 Duties include:
   

  

* Coordination and administration of the Alpha Cell programme.
* Planning and organizing meetings, documenting decisions, and ensuring timely communication.
* Developing and maintaining processes and procedures for efficient information management.
* Administrative and communication support for programme-related events and sessions.
* Booking travel and accommodation.
* Contributing to event planning and execution.


**What We Offer**
* A position at SciLifeLab, Sweden’s national organization of advancing life sciences and providing cutting edge technology infrastructure and data services
* A key role in a high-profile scientific program.
* A position at a leading technical university that contributes to a sustainable future
* A creative, international and dynamic environment
* A government position with excellent working conditions
* A lot of responsibility, independence and potential to grow in your professional role


 Read more about what it's like to work at KTH and our benefits.
   

  

**Qualifications**
**Requirements:**
* University degree or equivalent in a relevant field.
* Experience in administrative roles.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office and support systems, including data registration and follow-up.
* Strong writing skills.
* Fluent spoken and written Swedish and English.


 Personal skills:
   

  

* Service-oriented – Always aiming to support programme goals and stakeholders.
* Structured – Skilled at managing processes, timelines and follow-up.
* Accurate – Able to keep sight of both the broader scope and key details.
* Communicative – Confident in both internal and external communication.
* Interpersonally skilled – Effective in navigating complex organizational environments.
* Proactive - Taking initiative and thinking ahead to identify tasks and address them early


**Preferred qualifications:**
* Education in project management or a PhD in molecular biology or related field.
* Experience from universities or other academic environments.
* Previous work in project coordination or communication.
* Experience in web-based communication tools.
* Experience in professional Google workspace environment


 Great emphasis will be placed on personal skills.
   

  

**Trade union representatives**
 Contact information to trade union representatives.
   

  

**To apply for the position**
 Log into KTH's recruitment system in order to apply for this position. You are responsible to ensure that your application is complete according to the instructions in the ad. Your complete application must be received by KTH no later than the last day of application, midnight CET/CEST (Central European Time/Central European Summer Time).
   

  

**About The Employment**
 The employment is valid until further notice (permanent post) according to agreement.
   

  

 The employment begins with a six-month probationary period.
   

  

**Other Information**
 Striving towards gender equality, diversity and equal conditions is both a question of quality for KTH and a given part of our values.
   

  

 Tests may be applied in this recruitment process.
   

  

 For information about processing of personal data in the recruitment process.
   

  

 It may be the case that a position at KTH is classified as a security-sensitive role in accordance with the Protective Security Act (2018:585). If this applies to the specific position, a security clearance will be conducted for the applicant in accordance with the same law with the applicant's consent. In such cases, a prerequisite for employment is that the applicant is approved following the security clearance.
   

  

 We firmly decline all contact with staffing and recruitment agencies and job ad salespersons.

title: AI Solution Manager
description:
Vill du vara med att forma och utveckla hur AI används i en av Nordens mest dynamiska IT-organisationer? På itm8 söker vi nu en person som vill driva konkreta AI-initiativ i vår verksamhet samt till våra kunder – med fokus på både Microsofts AI-plattformar och andra ledande teknologier som Nvidia, Meta och open source-ramverk.
   

  

 Som AI Solution Manager hos oss blir du en nyckelperson i att identifiera, utveckla och implementera AI-lösningar som förbättrar våra interna processer. Du kommer att arbeta nära verksamheten för att förstå behov, prioritera use cases och omsätta idéer till skalbara lösningar. Du får också en viktig roll i att höja AI-mognaden i organisationen genom workshops, utbildningar och förändringsledning.
   

  

 Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter inkluderar:
   

  

* Identifiera och prioritera interna AI-use cases (t.ex. automatisk ticket-routing, prediktivt underhåll, offertautomatisering)
* Utveckla och produktionssätta AI-lösningar i samarbete med verksamheten
* Arbeta med Microsoft Copilot, Azure AI Services, Power Platform – samt gärna även andra AI-ramverk som TensorFlow, PyTorch, HuggingFace, Nvidia AI eller Meta Llama
* Bidra till AI-governance, best practices och intern kunskapsspridning
* Hålla dig uppdaterad om trender inom AI och föreslå nya verktyg och metoder
* Stötta i externa kunddialoger där AI är en strategisk komponent
* Vara delaktig som expert i itm8 AI council


 Vi ser gärna att du har några års erfarenhet inom:
   

  

* Leda och utveckla AI/ML-projekt, självklart i någon molnmiljö
* Goda kunskaper i Python och ML-ramverk som scikit-learn, spaCy, Transformers
* AI-livscykeln i form av modellträning, inferens, drift, MLOps
* Arbetat med LLM:er, NLP, generativ AI och prompt engineering
* Kommunicera AI-koncept på ett pedagogiskt och inspirerande sätt för olika målgrupper


 Meriterande är om du även har erfarenhet inom:
   

  

* Erfarenhet av Microsoft Copilot, Azure OpenAI, Power Platform.
* Kunskap om AI-tillämpningar inom DevOps, ERP, CRM eller BI.
* Intresse för datahantering, dataskydd och AI-governance.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta i matrisorganisationer och leda förändring.


 itm8 är en av Nordens ledande leverantörer av digital transformation och IT-tjänster. Läs mer om vår resa på www.itm8.se och följ oss på Instagram @itm8inside.
   

  

 Redo att utmana och utmanas inom AI med itm8?
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan! Om du har frågor, skriv till oss i meddelanderutan nedan så följer vi upp med dig. Vi behandlar alla ansökningar och kontakter konfidentiellt och intervjuar löpande och rekommenderar att du söker tjänsten så snart som möjligt.

title: Creative Content Specialist (Parental Cover - 12 Months)
description:
**Locations** 
 : Stockholm | Helsinki
   

  

 Who We Are
   

  

 Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Today, we help clients with total transformation-inspiring complex change, enabling organizations to grow, building competitive advantage, and driving bottom-line impact.
   

  

 To succeed, organizations must blend digital and human capabilities. Our diverse, global teams bring deep industry and functional expertise and a range of perspectives to spark change. BCG delivers solutions through leading-edge management consulting along with technology and design, corporate and digital ventures—and business purpose. We work in a uniquely collaborative model across the firm and throughout all levels of the client organization, generating results that allow our clients to thrive.
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

 Are you a creative doer with a passion for crafting compelling digital stories and content? We are looking for a hands-on Content Creator Specialist to join our Nordic marketing team for a 12-month parental cover.
   

  

 Your Main Responsibility Will Be To Create Content, From The First Idea To The Final Product. You Sometimes Work Independently, Occasionally As a Team, And Always With Support From Our Project Leaders. You Will
   

  

* Create engaging visuals, produce videos, and write copies for our social and digital channels.
* Simplify complex topics into clear and attention-grabbing content tailored to different audiences.
* Concept, build and execute engaging visual content and creative campaigns.
* Handle multiple projects simultaneously in a fast-paced environment.


 You will have creative freedom within a structured, supportive team. You will have lots of ownership and room to create, but you must also manage your projects, often working across teams and with many stakeholders.
   

  

 We mostly create content for Instagram, Facebook, and LinkedIn – sometimes Web and Youtube. Here we seek to engage business leaders, young professionals, and students alike.
   

  

 What You'll Bring
   

  

* Creativity takes many forms, and this role doesn’t require you to master them all equally. Whether your strength is visual storytelling, concept development, or copywriting, there’s space to lean into your strongest skills and opportunities to explore and learn in the role.
* Strong English skills. We write almost exclusively in English, and while you don't need to be a native speaker, you should feel comfortable expressing ideas effectively.
* You are fluent in Adobe Creative Suite, Canva, Figma, or similar platforms independently, and without relying on preset templates.
* Ability to write clear and concise copy that catches attention


**Most Importantly, You Are**
* A doer with a vision: self-sufficient, structured, and creatively curious.
* Eager to explore and experiment with digital trends and techniques
* Collaborative, but unafraid to challenge and push the work.
* Formal education in creative/visual communication, art direction, design, journalism, marketing, or related fields
* Previous content creation experience, especially from an agency, consultancy, or similar environment


 Who You'll Work With
   

  

 You’ll join BCG’s Nordic marketing team, responsible for enhancing and protecting the firm’s reputation as a global thought leader. Our primary focus includes strengthening BCG’s brand, advancing key business priorities, and strategically engaging our audiences. We utilize tools such as global thought-leadership publications, public relations initiatives, alumni engagement, recruitment marketing, and social media.
   

  

 As part of the content team, you’ll play a central role in how we use storytelling to raise awareness and inspire action around some of the world’s most complex challenges.
   

  

 Additional info
   

  

 We offer
   

  

* A centrally located office, engaging social activities, and the flexibility to balance working from home.
* An inspiring work environment consisting of 17 dedicated Nordic marketing professionals across all Nordic capitals, supported by a global community of over 300 marketing experts.
* Excellent opportunities for professional growth, and the chance to contribute meaningfully to strategic initiatives within a globally recognized organization.
* Comprehensive insurance package
* Market competitive pension package
* 30 days of vacation
* Social networks – Pride@BCG, Women@BCG, Family@BCG


 How to Apply
   

  

 Please submit your application by attaching your CV, including few lines on motivation for role, through our BCG Career website by August 11th, 2025. We process all applications we receive and screen them continuously during the application period.
   

  

 Boston Consulting Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under national, provincial, or local law, where applicable, and those with criminal histories will be considered in a manner consistent with applicable state and local laws.
   

  

 BCG is an E - Verify Employer. Click here for more information on E-Verify.

title: Field Application Engineer - Telecom Hardware
company_industry: Retail Appliances, Electrical, and Electronic Equipment
description:
**About Us**
**DISCOVER RADIALL**
 Since 1952, we have been designing and manufacturing cutting-edge technologies for some of the world's most demanding applications.
   

  

 From space exploration to communication to aviation, our international teams are working to create interconnect components that power the future. Our sites are located in different countries, including France, Italy, United-States, China, Mexico and India. At the heart of our factories, we grow industrial know-how including molding, plating and component assembly.
   

  

 We are a community of more than 3,000 employees, rich in diversity, with a strong team spirit and open to all of those around us. Dare to be audacious, Make it Simple, Be genuine and Grow together are the 4 values guiding our actions every day.
   

  

 At Radiall, we have made a choice: "Creating connections that matter". This is how we expressed our purpose, which invites us to work for a better world, through topics that we have identified and on which we can act.
   

  

**Mission**
**OUR MISSION**
 As a Field Application Engineer (FAE)
 **Electromechanical Hardware** 
 , you act as a trusted technical advisor, bringing in-depth knowledge of Radiall’s solutions and their applications. Your mission: analyze customer needs, provide technical guidance, and coordinate internal and external stakeholders to deliver effective and profitable solutions.
   

  

 You will be the key interface between customers and Radiall teams (Engineering, Sales, Manufacturing, Quality), ensuring alignment across all aspects of the project lifecycle.
   

  

**Key Activities Include**
* Develop and maintain strong technical relationships with strategic customers.
* Lead pre-sales technical discussions, define customer requirements, and negotiate technical aspects including compliance matrices, datasheets, and qualification plans.
* Prepare technical specifications and draft PENs for complex products or sub-systems.
* Deliver product demonstrations and presentations tailored to customer needs and sales efforts.
* Collaborate with the Sales team to assess opportunities, define strategy, and execute acquisition plans.
* Coordinate product evaluations, pricing strategies, and performance expectations.
* Support the Quality team in resolving product-related performance issues.
* Identify opportunities for expanding the product portfolio.
* Validate technical and commercial offers in the context of new developments or PENs.
* Translate customer expectations into actionable steps to ensure high-quality service and support.
* Ensure fast and effective resolution of customer concerns.


**Profile**
**PROFILE**
 You have a solid engineering background and extensive experience in technical-commercial roles. Your mindset, language skills, and global readiness make you a valuable asset for a high-impact position.
   

  

 Education & Experience
   

  

* Engineering Degree (or equivalent)
* Minimum 15 years of experience in a technical-commercial environment
* Strong technical foundation in RF board-to-board applications


 Skills & Mindset
   

  

* High level of autonomy – capable of operating independently
* Proactive and self-motivated with a strong sense of initiative
* Entrepreneurial spirit and solid business mindset
* Ability to challenge and support both internal teams and customers constructively
* Comfortable navigating remote management structures
* Effective in international and multicultural environments


 Mobility & Availability
   

  

* Willingness and flexibility to travel worldwide as needed


 Languages
   

  

* Fluent in English

title: People Sustainability Specialist
description:
**Introduction**
 This position is located in Södertälje, Sweden. But for the right person we can make it work with a candidate in another country.
   

  

 Scania is undergoing a transformation from being a leading supplier of trucks, buses, and engines to providing complete and sustainable transport solutions. Together with TRATON and our sister brands MAN, Volkswagen Truck & Bus, and International, we are working to shape the future of mobility with innovative and environmentally conscious solutions.
   

  

 Our values – customer first, respect, team spirit, responsibility, and elimination of waste – are at the heart of everything we do. Together, we are at the forefront of creating a sustainable future.
   

  

**Role Summary**
 Scania’s purpose is to drive the shift towards a sustainable transport system. As part of this transformation — from a producer of trucks, buses and engines to a provider of end-to-end sustainable transport solutions — the company places strong emphasis on digitalisation, electrification and automation. Sustainability is fully integrated into this purpose, including a dedicated focus on People Sustainability.
   

  

 To strengthen our efforts in this field, we are now looking for a Global People Sustainability Specialist to continue and develop the strategic and operational work related to compliance, due diligence and employer responsibility within People & Culture.
   

  

 Scania is part of the TRATON Group, which among, others also includes MAN, International, VW T&B.
   

  

**Job Responsibilities**
**Compliance Coordination**
 Act as Scania’s point of contact for HR compliance matters within the TRATON Group. Align Scania’s approach with group-wide regulatory requirements and represent Scania in TRATON compliance forums.
   

  

**HR Compliance Communication, Training & Audit Readiness**
 Plan and support the implementation of HR compliance communication and training initiatives, in line with internal policies and audit requirements. Ensure readiness for internal and external assessments, and follow up on audit findings.
   

  

**Human Rights & Due Diligence**
 Develop and maintain processes for labour- and human rights due diligence from an employer perspective. Contribute to Scania’s risk management process by assisting to identify and assess risks and impacts across Scania’s operations and contribute to mitigation strategies.
   

  

**Whistleblowing & Investigations**
 Coordinate HR-related whistleblowing cases and serve as a resource for investigators, ensuring quality assurance and alignment with internal and group-level reporting procedures.
   

  

**Non-Financial Reporting**
 Support and coordinate Scania’s contributions to CSRD/ESRS reporting (particularly S1), including preparation of inputs, tracking of risks, and validation of mitigation measures. Align with Legal, Corporate Sustainability, and the ESG team to ensure consistency in data and narrative.
   

  

**Stakeholder Engagement**
 Monitor international trends and regulations and translate them together with TRATON into Scania-relevant practices. Collaborate closely with Legal, Compliance, Corporate Sustainability, the ESG team, and P&C to secure alignment.
   

  

**External Networks**
 Represent Scania in relevant international networks and channel insights into the organisation.
   

  

 Who you are
   

  

 Academic degree or equivalent competence in a relevant field (e.g. human rights, labour law, human resource compliance)
   

  

 Proven experience in People Sustainability at a global level, particularly related to human rights and social compliance
   

  

 Understanding of legal and ESG-related demands (e.g. CSRD, CSDDD)
   

  

 Experience in project coordination or cross-functional leadership roles
   

  

 Strong communication skills and proficiency in English (oral and written)
   

  

 Collaborative and consultative working style
   

  

 Ability to work independently and drive initiatives forward
   

  

 Adaptable and experienced in navigating complex or transforming environments
   

  

 Experience in a global matrix organisation is an advantage
   

  

 We welcome applicants from all backgrounds – your unique experience and perspectives is valuable to us.
   

  

 This is us
   

  

 People & Culture (P&C) enables managers and employees by creating the conditions they need to succeed, always with proximity to the business.
   

  

 The People Sustainability team, part of Leadership, Culture & People Sustainability, works cross-functionally to develop and support Scania's employer responsibility in areas such as organisational design, change management, labour relations, social impact, and HR compliance — including human rights. This work is primarily executed through collaboration with the global and local P&C organisations and through active engagement with the TRATON Group.
   

  

 Scania Offers
   

  

 We offer a dynamic, flexible workplace with hybrid work options, including Scania Sergel and Midway hubs. With a structured development plan and courses, Scania supports your career growth both locally and internationally.
   

  

 Benefits include training at our health center Gröndal or wellness allowance, result bonus, flexible hours, and company car leasing. Scania also hosts events for employees and their families, and Stockholm residents enjoy direct access to Södertälje via Scania Job express buses for an easy commute to Södertälje.
   

  

 Application
   

  

 Your application should include a CV and any relevant certificates. We welcome all applicants and strive for diversity in our recruitment processes.
   

  

 Apply as soon as possible, no later than 2025-08-09. Screening will take place on an ongoing basis during the application period. Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check may be required for this role.
   

  

 If you have questions or would like more information, please contact: Willem Mos, Functional Lead & COE Coordinator, wim.mos@scania.com.

title: Account Executive
description:
⭐
 **Ready for a new challenge? Here is what we offer.** 




**Team spirit, built upon trust & ownership.** 




 Together, we decide how to win. We trust each other and take great ownership in what we do. We respect the individual, assume the best in others and believe in close collaboration and communication, within and outside of the team.
 



  





**New challenges and personal growth.** 




 We live by our entrepreneurial spirit, this means taking risks, identifying opportunities and always seeking new solutions. Do you have ideas how we can scale even faster? Bring them on!
 



  





**A passionate and fun culture.** 




 We are passionate about our work and believe that having lots of fun is essential for both creativity and success. Welcome to a diverse and inclusive workplace, with a lot of fun and exciting activities going on- including Health Month, inspirational sessions, team activities, company trips and board game nights.
 



  





**A stable and global industry-leader based in Stockholm, expanding and scaling to new markets!** 




 We’re in a great position to drive success and seize new opportunities, our international customer base is constantly growing and so is our product. With the support of our new owners, we are making moves to expand into new markets, setting a clear course for growth in 2025.
 



 Today, we are a category leader within Creative Management Platforms and we are proud of it.
 



  





**🦋 Are you + Bannerflow = true?** 




 We believe you’re a self-starter with a proactive mindset and a natural ability to turn ideas into action. You get energized by fast-paced, high-growth environments and you don’t wait for opportunities to land in your lap, you build them from the ground up.
 



 You feel confident in navigating complex enterprise sales, quickly identifying customer pain points and translating them into tangible business value. With a deep understanding of the full sales cycle, you tailor your approach to different stakeholders and guide them toward smart, strategic outcomes. Experience in martech is a strong plus.
 



 Prospecting isn’t just part of the job, it’s something you take pride in. You know how to spark meaningful conversations, ask the right questions, and connect real problems with real solutions. You’re confident leading presentations and commercial discussions, always keeping things consultative, value-driven, and grounded in trust. Challenging assumptions doesn’t faze you; you see it as an opportunity to elevate the conversation.
 



  





**In This Role, You Will** 



* Drive awareness in the market and fuel your own pipeline through active outreach and lead generation.
* Reach out to, engage, and educate potential customers on the value of Bannerflow.
* Qualify and disqualify prospects strategically and focusing your efforts where we solve real pain.
* Conduct product demos and become a trusted advisor in the world of digital advertising.
* Continuously evaluate and optimize how we work and suggesting better ways forward.
* Collaborate with colleagues, sharing wins, learnings, and insights.



  





**What We’re Looking For** 



* Proven experience in B2B sales, ideally with a SaaS product.
* 1-2 years of experience in solution selling, with a strong commercial mindset.
* A true self-starter who thrives in an outbound-heavy role, where prospecting comes naturally to you.
* A motivated and ambitious individual, eager to continue to grow a career in sales.
* Someone who understands how to turn customer pain points into actionable solutions.
* Strong communication skills in English, any additional European language is a bonus.



  





**Why join us? 🤔** 




 At Bannerflow, we live by our values of passion, collaboration, and challenge. As an Account Executive, you’ll help us continue to revolutionize the Ad Tech industry through cutting-edge technology and product excellence. You’ll also get to enjoy our fun and engaging culture with activities like padel tournaments, webinars, Friday beers, and Level-up Hackathons. We offer a hybrid workplace and a competitive compensation package including pension according to ITP1, health allowance, parental leave top-up, and health care insurance. We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive team and welcome applications from candidates of all backgrounds, experiences, and abilities.
 



  





 📌As we’re currently enjoying the Swedish summer, we’ll begin reviewing applications in August. Thanks for your patience!

title: Sourcing Manager
company_industry: Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage
description:

Vi är mitt i en spännande förändringsresa där inköp står högt på agendan. Här får du möjlighet att påverka på riktigt, i en organisation som spelar en avgörande roll i samhället.**

 I rollen som Sourcing Manager arbetar du tätt tillsammans med sakägare för att optimera koncernens inköp med fokus på kostnadseffektivitet, kundnytta, hållbarhet och lagmässiga krav. Du ingår i ett sammansvetsat inköpsteam bestående av Category Managers, Sourcing Managers och Sourcing Analysts, som tillsammans med organisationens olika delar driver strategiska inköpsinitiativ för att skapa långsiktigt värde för hela koncernen.

* Utvecklar och omförhandlar befintliga leverantörsavtal samt säkerställer att avtal efterlevs

 ,

* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, tal och skrift


 Tidigare erfarenhet från LOU/LUF liksom att jobba i en internationell miljö är meriterande men inte ett krav.
   

  

**Du ska må bra**
 Vi Är Ett Modernt Kundorienterat Företag Som Tänker Lika Mycket På Våra Anställda Som På Våra Kunder. Hos Oss Erbjuds Du Ett Omväxlande Arbete i En Internationell Miljö Med Ständigt Nya Utmaningar Och Snabba Beslut. Förutom Schyssta Anställningsvillkor Enligt Kollektivavtal Erbjuds Du
   

  

* Flexibel hybrid arbetsplats. Se filmen om vårt kontor.
* Goda utvecklings- och karriärmöjligheter
* Goda försäkrings- och tjänstepensionsvillkor
* Friskvårdsbidrag samt möjlighet att träna på Arkens gym och simhall
* Personalförmåner genom PostNord Plus - vår personalstiftelse


**Om oss**
 PostNord's vision är att vara favoritleverantören i Norden. Vi har ett viktigt samhällsuppdrag och säkerställer kommunikations- och logistiklösningar för företag och privatpersoner. Vi är i en ständig transformation och arbetar konsekvent med att utveckla både vårt erbjudande och våra medarbetare, allt för att nå vår vision samt göra vardagen enklare och mer hållbar för alla som bor och arbetar i Norden. Vi är PostNord - ett fantastiskt företag att jobba och växa med. Läs mer på group.postnord.com
   

  

**Vad väntar du på?**
 Vi kommer att påbörja urvalsarbetet först i augusti men ser gärna att du ansöker så snart du kan! I den här rekryteringen samarbetar PostNord med Jefferson Wells. Om du har frågor eller funderingar, vänligen maila malin.magnusson@jeffersonwells.se eller ring på 076-780 68 64.

title: SAP Release Manager
company_industry: Paper and Forest Product Manufacturing and Packaging and Containers Manufacturing
description:
**Job Description**
 At Billerud we believe that when we have tomorrow in mind, we will do our very best today. It is thanks to our employees that we are a world-leading company within the field of renewable paper and packaging materials. Do you want to realize your true value and work for a sustainable tomorrow? Join us!
   

  

**Become a key player in Billerud's SAP Transformation journey as a Release Manager**
 We are looking for a proactive and detail-oriented Release Manager to join our IT team, with a strong focus on managing releases within our SAP S/4HANA landscape.
   

  

 This is a new role at Billerud. The final candidate will have the responsibility to create, transform and implement release management processes from the ground up, ideally drawing on prior experience from greenfield SAP implementations, as well as establish relevant forums in order to meet business needs.
   

  

 As the release manager you will be responsible for planning, coordinating and overseeing the delivery of changes and new functionalities across our SAP S/4HANA systems and integrated platforms. You will work closely with Process Workstreams in the transformation program, our newly created SAP maintenance team, as well as development teams, Operations, and business stakeholders to ensure high-quality and timely deployments in a complex enterprise environment.
   

  

**In This Role You Will Be Responsible For**
 Release and Change Management
   

  

* Coordinate release planning and execution across SAP and SAP-connected systems. Examples of components (S/4Hana (L2C, F2P,S2P, A2D, F2C), Ariba, IBP, BTP etc)
* Prioritize and allocate resources effectively to meet deadlines and resolve conflicts during release cycles.
* Create, maintain and communicate a global release calendar to minimize business disruption.
* Serve as the central liaison for coordinating releases with SAP RISE operations, third-party AMS providers and internal development teams.
* Define and implement standardized release governance processes.
* Oversee release cutover planning, dry-runs, validation, and post-deployment support readiness.


 Process Development & Improvement
   

  

* Track and report on release health metrics.
* Ensure traceability and documentation in SAP Solution Manager, ITSM System and JIRA.


 You will be based at any of our sites in Sweden such as Gävle, Gruvön, Frövi, Skärblacka, Karlsborg or Stockholm, Solna.
   

  

 Travels to our headquarters in Solna will occur and travels to North America may be required to support Release process and project activities.
   

  

**We don’t offer relocation packages, and a Swedish work permit is requested for this position.**
 At Billerud, we put Safety First. Together we take great pride in our responsibility to contribute to a safe work environment. Please read more about our Safety First initiative
   

  

**Qualifications**
**To succeed in the role of IT Release Manager, we believe you have:**
* Documented IT education at university level or equivalent.
* Documented IT education at university level or equivalent.
* Experience in designing and implementing release management processes in greenfield SAP S/4HANA environments.
* Extensive experience in IT project management, or SAP administration, with experience focused on managing SAP landscapes, SAP Solution Manager and ITIL processes.
* Experience working with cloud environments and coordinating with third-party AMS vendors.
* Practical understanding of DevOps and agile methodologies (Scrum, SAFe).


**Preferred Certifications**
* ITIL Foundation or Advanced Certification.
* SAP certifications in relevant modules (e.g., SAP S/4HANA, SAP Cloud Platform).
* Cloud certifications (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) optional.


**We don’t offer relocation packages and a Swedish work permit is requested for this position.**
**Personal qualities**
 We place great emphasis on your personality. The ideal candidate is a proactive and solution-oriented team player who thrives in environments where structures and processes are not yet fully established. You enjoy taking ownership and building ways of working from the ground up and you are motivated by the opportunity to shape and implement release management processes in a greenfield SAP landscape.
   

  

 You are innovative and unafraid to try new approaches, with a natural ability to connect people and act as the “spider in the web” across teams and stakeholders. Strong leadership and coordination skills are essential for orchestrating complex global release cycles across multiple systems and teams. You are structured, strategic and comfortable navigating ambiguity and shifting priorities.
   

  

 Our values are very important for us and we believe that you recognize yourself in: We care for each other and We do what we say.
   

  

**Contact**
 If you would like to know more about the position, please contact Ann Josefsson, Senior Director Global IT Applications, at Ann.Josefsson@billerud.com. For more information about the recruitment process, please contact Julia Åkerlund, Talent Acquisition Partner, at julia.akerlund@billerud.com.
   

  

 We kindly decline offers from external recruitment providers.
   

  

**Application information**
**Welcome with your application no later than August 10th.**
 Selection will take place after the application deadline. Due to the holiday season, feedback and communication may take longer than usual during the summer period.
   

  

 Billerud is an equal opportunity employer. We embrace diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees and candidates.
   

  

**Why us?**
* Join both a local and global team of skilled professionals!An opportunity to contribute to a more sustainable future
* Development and career opportunities
* Performance-based bonus, occupational pension and a number of different benefits according to company policy.
* Opportunity to hybrid working according to company standard.


**Our recruitment process** 
 will include interviews, recruitment test, reference checks, alcohol- & drug test as well as a background check.
   

  

**Do you want to help create a sustainable future through your work?**
 At Billerud, we are fully committed to reduce our and our customers carbon footprint by offering high-performance paper and packaging materials. We are convinced that the right solutions can be important tools to help fight climate change. That's why we see it as our responsibility to enable the best packaging choices, for a better tomorrow.
   

  

 Our proud history in the forestry and paper industry goes back more than 150 years. Since then, we’ve grown to what we are today: a world leading company in high-performing paper and packaging materials - passionately committed to sustainability, quality, and customer value. Our materials are the basis of packaging and paper products used by millions of people around the world, 24 hours a day, all year round.
   

  

 We serve customers in more than 100 countries through our three business areas Liquid Packaging Board, Paper and Paper Board. Our nine production units are located in Sweden, USA, and Finland and we have around 6,000 employees in 19 countries. Our annual turnover is approximately SEK 43.5 billion and the share is listed on Nasdaq Stockholm. At Billerud we always put safety first, care for each other, and do what we say.
   

  

**Join us in redefining sustainable packaging and drive meaningful change for a better tomorrow.**

title: Underwriting Representative Germany
description:
Dedicated to powering entrepreneurs, Qred is a profitable, fast-growing fintech scale-up bank. In just 10 years, we’ve grown from startup to scale-up, now generating over €85 million in annual revenue, supporting more than 50,000 entrepreneurs, and helping create 10,000+ jobs each year. We combine smart tech with real-world experience to make funding simple, fast, and fair for entrepreneurs who need it most. With strong backing, a flat organization, and bold growth plans, we’re now looking for a German speaking Undrwriter to join us and shape the future of small business owners.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As an Underwriter at Qred, you are responsible for assessing the creditworthiness of small business loan applicants in our fast growing German Team. Your main tasks include analyzing financial documents, reviewing bank transactions, and identifying potential risks. You work closely with the rest of the team that consists of Underwriting, Customer Success and Pre-Collection to ensure fast, accurate, and responsible lending decisions. Your goal is to balance business growth with risk management while supporting entrepreneurs with fair and fast access to financing.
   

  

 This is a fast-paced, dynamic role with a lot of variety. It’s perfect for someone who thrives in action, and is excited to contribute to building a successful department from the ground up - all while having fun along the way!
   

  

**You will:**
* Be handling customers business loan applications through telephone, chat, and email
* Prepare tailored loan offers to the business's needs together with our Customer Success Team
* Analyse financial data across all company forms using various tools, platforms and submitted documents
* Develop a healthy customer lifecycle by offering personal service and a suitable business repayment plan


**Sounds like a good way of working right? Here’s what we're looking for:**
* A flexible and positive mindset and you enjoy working as a team
* Enjoys working in a dynamic environment with a lot of things on your plate
* The ability to see the whole picture and understand the business not only based on financial data.
* Fluent in German and good English


**Experiences that makes you stand out from the rest:**
* Experience with some kind of customer service and/or within sales
* Experience in analysing financial data is a big plus


**Why join us?**
 This is a unique opportunity to join a growing fintech company that is redefining financial services for small businesses in Northern Europe. You’ll work with a passionate and innovative team, participating in creating an environment where employees thrive and contribute to a shared vision of success.
   

  

**One last thing**
 This is a full-time, permanent position based in Stockholm. Don’t wait to send in your application, we are reviewing applications on a rolling basis. While the start date is flexible, the right candidate can join us immediately.
   

  

*Qred celebrates diversity and does not discriminate based on ethnicity, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, disability status, or any other applicable characteristics protected by law.*
 Qred is an international FinTech scale-up that specializes in digital financing solutions for small businesses, with operations in the Nordics, Benelux, Germany and Brazil. We are passionate about helping small businesses thrive and grow, by providing them with business loans and credit cards. Right now we’re in an exciting phase of our journey that focuses on growth through smart product development and technology fueled by international expansion.

title: Employer Brand Manager | Stockholm
description:
At EY, we’re all in to shape your future with confidence.
   

  

 We’ll help you succeed in a globally connected powerhouse of diverse teams and take your career wherever you want it to go.
   

  

 Join EY and help to build a better working world.
   

  

 Har du en passion för varumärkesbyggande och vill vara med och forma framtidens arbetsplats? Vi söker nu en Brand Manager med särskilt fokus på Employer Branding till vår agila nordiska varumärkes-, marknadsförings- och kommunikationsavdelning (Brand Marketing & Communications, BMC).
   

  

**Möjligheten** 
  

  

 Vi erbjuder dig en spännande tjänst i en marknadsledande organisation med goda lärande- och utvecklingsmöjligheter. Hos oss hittar du en trevlig och inkluderande arbetsmiljö som vi hoppas att du vill bidra till.
   

  

 Hos oss får du stor frihet att skapa och genomföra innovativa åtgärder som framhäver EYs attraktivitet som arbetsgivare. Dessa åtgärder ska förmedla företagets expertis, kvaliteten på våra tjänster, innovativa tillvägagångssätt för digital transformation och engagemang för hållbarhet och etisk praxis.
   

  

**Ansvarsområden**
 Vi arbetar i tvärfunktionella team och du kommer att ingå i branding-enheten, där vi kopplar Employer Branding till den övergripande varumärkesstrategin. Dina uppgifter kommer att involvera att arbeta med intressenter över företagets avdelningar, i det dagliga med kollegor i BMC, i Talent (HR) och vår mediebyrå, där du designar och aktiverar varumärkesupplevelsen genom hela medarbetarlivscykeln, från rekrytering till alumni. Ansvarsområden inom rollen inkluderar bland annat:
   

  

* Utveckla varumärkesstrategi baserat på vår EVP; Shape your future with confidence
* Leda sprintteam och själv vara hands-on med att aktivera kampanjer och initiativ, samt mäta effekten av dessa
* Utarbeta innehåll till sociala medier och ey.com, orkestrera för sömlösa digitala upplevelser över kanaler och skapa ’brand moments’ via events och happenings.
* Målrikta 360-kommunikation mot utvalda målgrupper, både studenter och erfarna experter inom bland annat revision, skatt, affärsjuridik, transaktioner och rådgivning
* Representera Norden i möten med EY kollegor i övriga världen


**Färdigheter och egenskaper för framgång**
* Kandidatexamen inom marknadsföring, kommunikation eller liknande studieområde
* Minst 4 års erfarenhet av varumärkesbyggande, helst med fokus på Employer Branding
* Stark kompetens inom sociala medier och digitala trender
* Utmärkta kommunikationsfärdigheter, muntligt och skriftligt, på svenska och engelska
* Inkluderande, förändringsbenägen och gillar att arbeta i internationella team
* En förståelse för användarpersonas och kandidat-/medarbetarresor
* Förmåga att bygga relationer med intressenter på seniora nivåer och ge strategiska råd baserat på data om bästa praxis för varumärke, marknadsföring och kommunikation
* Självgående och proaktiv
* Gillar att arbeta efter deadlines och kan hantera flera projekt parallellt


**Idealt har du också**
* Erfarenhet av agil arbetsmetodik och komplexa arbetsmiljöer


**Vad vi erbjuder dig**
 På EY kommer vi att hjälpa dig utveckla och anpassa dina färdigheter framåt utifrån en upplevelse i världsklass.  Vi stärker dig i en flexibel miljö och låter dig och din kompentens blomma i en kultur som värdesätter mångfald och inkludering på en global nivå. Läs mer här.
   

  

**Är du redo att “
 *Shape your future with confidence”* 
 ? Ansök idag.** 
  

  

 Vänligen skicka in din ansökan senast den 15 augusti 2025. Notera att urval och intervjuer sker löpande med start från och med mitten på augusti. Vid frågor gällande tjänsten, kontakta Tom Berneskog på Tom.Bernerskog@se.ey.com. Vid frågor gällande rekryteringsprocessen, kontakta Simon Aspler på simon.aspler@se.ey.com. Tillträde sker enligt överenskommelse. Observera att en bakgrundskontroll kommer att genomföras som en del av rekryteringsprocessen.
   

  

 På EY värdesätter vi mångfald och uppmuntrar ansökningar från individer från olika bakgrunder. Om du har frågor, behöver stöd, eller anpassning av rekryteringsprocessen på grund av en funktionsnedsättning, tveka inte på att kontakta oss på recruitmentsweden@se.ey.com. Vi finns här för att stötta dig.
   

  

**EY | Building a better working world**
 EY is building a better working world by creating new value for clients, people, society and the planet, while building trust in capital markets.
   

  

 Enabled by data, AI and advanced technology, EY teams help clients shape the future with confidence and develop answers for the most pressing issues of today and tomorrow.
   

  

 EY teams work across a full spectrum of services in assurance, consulting, tax, strategy and transactions. Fueled by sector insights, a globally connected, multi-disciplinary network and diverse ecosystem partners, EY teams can provide services in more than 150 countries and territories.

title: Cost Controller within Maintenance
description:
Are you a structured and analytical controller with an industrial background?
   

  

 Join Nynas as a Cost Controller within Maintenancne and play a key role in managing the financial performance of one of our most complex and high-impact operations. Help ensure cost control, financial accuracy, and budget adherence during our scheduled refinery turnarounds.
   

  

**About The Role**
 At Nynas, we perform a major turnaround every four years- a large-scale, planned shutdown of our refinery operations to carry out essential maintenance, inspections, and upgrades. These events require intense cross-functional collaboration and precise coordination under a tight schedule.
   

  

 As
 **Turnaround & Pitstop Cost Controller** 
 , you will be responsible for overseeing the financial aspects of turnaround projects. This includes developing and managing budgets, tracking and forecasting costs, identifying variances, and ensuring full compliance with financial policies. While the role is primarily operational, it also includes tactical responsibilities such as refining cost control methods and enhancing reporting tools.
   

  

 You will work independently within the framework of our financial guidelines and collaborate closely with planners, engineers, procurement specialists, and project managers. The position is based at our Nynäshamn refinery and reports to the Turnaround Manager.
   

  

 This is a dynamic and rewarding opportunity to join a committed team where your insights will directly impact operational efficiency and cost performance. You’ll contribute to a well-established company while continuing to grow professionally.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Take full ownership of cost control and financial reporting for turnaround-related activities.
* Develop, manage and monitor turnaround budgets, including cost estimation, forecasting, and variance analysis.
* Track daily turnaround expenditures, analyze deviations from the budget, and propose corrective actions.
* Collaborate with procurement, planning, and execution teams to ensure accurate cost allocations and forecast adjustments.
* Prepare detailed cost reports and presentations for management, providing insights into cost trends and risk areas.
* Support post-turnaround financial reviews, capturing lessons learned and identifying improvement and cost-saving opportunities.
* Ensure all financial practices are in compliance with company accounting standards and internal policies.


**About You**
 To thrive in this role, you are structured, analytical, and results driven. You excel in fast-paced environments and are comfortable taking ownership of financial responsibilities in complex technical projects. You are an effective communicator who can explain financial implications clearly to both financial and non-financial stakeholders.
   

  

 You also bring a proactive, hands-on approach to problem solving and enjoy developing smarter ways of working within established frameworks.
   

  

**Your Qualifications:**
* Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting, Engineering or related field
* Minimum 5 years of experience in cost control or financial analysis, ideally in industrial projects or turnarounds
* Strong proficiency in budgeting, forecasting, variance analysis, and financial reporting.
* High level of independence and ownership in managing project financials
* Excellent communication skills in both English and Swedish


**About Nynas**
**Advancing the transition to a sustainable society**
 Nynas is a specialty chemicals company producing high-performance bitumen and naphthenic solutions essential to infrastructure, electrification, and other industrial applications. Mainly focused on Europe, our products play a key role in supporting the shift towards a sustainable future. Through strategic partnerships and a strong commitment to safety and efficiency, Nynas is making a positive impact on society and the environment.
   

  

**Contact & Application**
 Please note that the recruitment process will take longer than usual due to the summer period. Last day to apply is the 6th of August and we will start with the selection after this date. For questions about the job, you can contact TA & Pitstop ManagerMarianna Xynou, marianna.xynou@nynas.com
